m0xBSoDHtDf--DTLKWJ27g.text: Good tasting food that I'll probably never taste again as I don't want to subject my family to that poor of service. I don't necessarily think that the place has bad service overall, for I witnessed our server take great care of the tables around us - offered fresh pepper, cheese, refills, dessert, etc. None were offered to us, we had to chase her down for refills and remind her the kids meal came with dessert. But what really puzzled me was the portion size of my entree. My linguine with clams entree was smaller than my 2 year old's spaghetti from the kids menu. Both served in the same bowl that's only slightly bigger than the small bread plate. We were excited to try their dessert but we never got that far. I normally base my reviews mostly on the taste of food and just explain my experience with service and ambiance, but the service was just THAT bad.

xfME-ZZ67dv6Aq77zP-w2Q.text: Their food is very good. They provide a complimentary plate with cheese, olives and peppers for a small starter. After, they give garlic knots (which are only ok. Not the best I've ever had, but still yummy. Besides, they're free.) I ordered a pasta & a pizza. The baked ziti was FANTASTIC! I really enjoyed the sauce, and it's very very cheesy. I had the Salame Picante Pizza, which was also very good. The crust is really why it was fantastic. It's a thin crust pizza, but not super crispy and hard to eat. The olives are definitely fresh, italian olives. Unfortunately, the food does not make this place worth going to. For a 75 dollar dinner (for two people) I expect MUCH more.   The reason I'm not giving it 4 or 5 stars is because of the atmosphere, lack of unprofessionalism, and the manager. Our server, who was from North Carolina, did well. No complaints there. My complaint is mostly in regards to the open kitchen and the manager, Dan, who truly does not care at all. With an open kitchen, you must teach your cooks how to behave. When I sit down in front of an open kitchen, I have zero desire to listen to the cooks personal music blasting from their phones. If you're gonna have an open kitchen, you should probably tell your cooks that if theres guests sitting four feet away, the music restaurant should suffice.   Something else that was frustrating was having the football game on. I personally don't care that the football game was on - especially since it's the beginning of the season. What I do mind is when you allow your staff to walk around yelling "TOUCHDOWN!" Again, there are guests here. I paid 75 dollars to eat my dinner in a nice restaurant, not buffalo wild wings.  LASTLY, my biggest issue of all - the manager Dan. When I expressed my concerns, Dan just stood there. After about 30 seconds, he says "I'll address it." Not a "Im sorry. You're right, that's not acceptable." Nothing. I already paid my bill, I had zero intention of a comped item. But Dan is by far the most lack luster, uncaring manager ever. Perhaps Trattoria Regiano in Venetian holds their staff to a higher standard than this location.  In sum, If you're going to Downtown Summerlin and are looking for a nice meal - go anywhere else. You'll actually enjoy the atmosphere of Shake Shack better.

pqIPkK2Gw1yUsiq9u1i-HQ.text: Beautiful restaurant; food is good so was service however the crowd is 50+ especially at the bar.

O810Y_QJl5-0yfWKdPciJQ.text: Comfortable Italian restaurant. Staff was polite and friendly, service is quick and attentive, food came out timely and hot. I recommend the Shrimp Stuffed with Crab Meat with Scampi sauce. Delicious. Attire is business casual.

oSPhwyAIVUoPurgp6YGXbA.text: Came here for the first time tonight for dinner. Both pizza and pasta were outstanding. Waiter brought some extra freebies while we were waiting for food to arrive. Placed was packed inside and out which was great for a Tuesday night. Will def return

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini &amp; clams all gone
Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great pizza

hqawtBNjXnBCj00qVZR_qg.text: I loved my meal at Trattoria Reggiano! I ordered the shrimp risotto and although the shrimp were a little tough, the risotto was absolutely delicious. The bread in the basket which came with the meal was soft and delightful. I really regretted leaving it behind, since we were traveling we couldn't take leftovers with us. My dining companion ordered the sea bass and loved it, it was prepared exactly the way he likes it. Our server was lovely and very attentive. I almost passed by this restaurant thinking a meal downtown would not be so great but I'm so glad we didn't. It turned out to be the best meal of our trip and I would highly recommend Trattoria Reggiano.

dqt0NEWDHonQGoHs5wX3mQ.text: Looked like a decent place for a meal, reasonable priced. But when we ordered we asked for a substitution on a pizza. Obviously was a crime since we were scolded by an older Italian man (only because he informed us he was Italian and they don't have sorporsetta only salami) I said weird as it says you have it on the menu (proceeded to point out to him) we were repaid by being served scorching hot pizza - enough to cause a 2nd degree burn.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burn caused by extremely hot pizza sauce. Be careful.

2xurqL5iMrLW9eWy9pnm1A.text: The food here was ok, nothing to write home about.  We had a large party and we got several different items.  The biggest problem I had is why I'm giving them 2 stars - their bartender apparently doesn't know what Blue Moon (the original wheat) is.  They had both the regular wheat on the menu and the "seasonal", which is a white IPA.  I told him that I wanted the original Blue Moon, to which he proceeded to argue with me telling me that Blue Moon IS an IPA. He said that they'd been getting people complaining because they thought it wasn't an IPA.  That's because it is most definitely not!!  He assured me that it was the regular Blue Moon so I ordered one.  It was the seasonal.  I didn't want to argue with him any further so I just let it go and someone else at the table drank it.    I hope that management will take this review into account and train their staff about the difference here.  This isn't an uncommon beer and most places carry it, so for it to taste like a completely different type of beer means that either your lines are mixed up or your staff doesn't know what they're serving.  If you're out of the regular that's fine, but don't try to tell me that something I've been drinking for over 6 years is something that it's not!  Please see my picture for proof of what I'm referring to.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Note the difference: White IPA (the seasonal Blue Moon offering) on the left &amp; the original Belgian-Style Wheat Ale on the right

bu_HQYpBTIxFQfeSRf1Wug.text: Pizza and wine...the rest was fine. That pretty much sums up our experience. We sat at the bar and despite it not being crowded, waited quite a long time before we were acknowledged by the bartender and even then had to wait longer for him to take our order...which came out half wrong. Another couple was also waiting at the bar and ended up leaving because the bartender never helped them.   The pizza was very good and I would come back for it but I do hope the service improves.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. margherita with burrata

fqEGK73-6fwO85HhXF2dUQ.text: We called in a pizza order and everything went well so far. Food was good. But after approaching the restaurant was when the bad service happened. Three workers were outside conversing with one another and did not acknowledge us. We spoke to who we assume as the host who told us to proceed to the bar for to go orders. The bartender was nowhere in sight. When she got back to the bar she did not notice me standing in front of the pizza box that was mine. She started grabbing glasses and assumed I wanted a drink but I told her I had a to go order. She roughly throws the bill on top of the pizza box to give to me and then immediately walks away to take an order of a table far away from the bar top. She spends longer than normal taking their order as I glared her down. I've had my credit card on hand since before she got to the bar so there was no wait in me giving her my card. She scans it and sets it down and proceeds to help other customers again! Needless to say, this to go order took as long as a dine in order. We could have finished our pizza in the time it took to wait for her to ring us up so we could leave. Terrible service at the bar. That woman deserves to be fired. Shorter brunette curly haired older woman. Rude and unapologetic. She is the sole reason we will never return even tho the food was decent and the phone call went normally.

NJq4ZRHpZZYJ_tYKNuA7Iw.text: My husband, granddaughter an I came here for lunch an let me say it was great. Loved the gact you can sit inside or outside. From the moment you walk in the place you know your going to have great food an Excellent service. I had the grilled chicken Cesare salad which was oh the hook. The flavor of the chicken was very good an cooked perfectly.  My husband had the Philly cheese  steak minus peppers an mushrooms an it was also good. An my he spaghetti our granddaughter had was good as well. The garlic knots omg...yummmm...The manager checked every order before it went out to make sure everything was perfect. Our server checked backed often to make sure we were ok as well as the manager. We will definitely be going back. All the food even the pizza looked amazing. Can't wait to try it all.

LHmF2gBR_6zBd6YIQlH7Ng.text: Always amazing, we are now long time repeat customers for years to come. Authentic Italian is hard to find. Super fresh food, great atmosphere in downtown summerlin, great staff. Love it! Can't go wrong with the Filet meatballs, calamari is so fresh-you can see them cutting it there, the CANNOLI and chocolate cake TO DIE FOR! Yum.

054aBJJYRXrrjWzUtpYHhw.text: My husband and I went here this past sunday we had a 530 reservation, it was not packed at all, The service was great, the food was great and our server Hilda was really nice.   Oh and real cannolis just like NY  yay   we will def be back

GiXxoWnBmfS1uzvc9DhBXw.text: This is one of my favorite local spots to go to. Ricki the server and manager Dan are the most welcoming and dynamic team. I love their meatballs and they have the BEST Italian kale salad that is simply a must try!!! The service is always incredible and I can count on a yummy meal and delicious wine. It's definitely a great place to hang out for happy hour or enjoy a nice dinner!

4rE18BVqJsgfkIbyhswwrg.text: I have eaten at this locally owned Italian restaurant four times since October.  My husband's family is Italian and the food here is like eating at Nannie's Sunday dinner.  The Veal Piccata is amazing.

Lpi7rx1sBwVkbMsCNUftSw.text: This review is for 3.5 stars.   Very good food with a good atmosphere, but the overall experience of the meal just didn't meet the standard of the other location in the strip. We had he house specialty pasta which came with a red sauce, sundried tomatoes, and spinach, as well as the gnocchi in a vodka sauce. Both pastas were delicious and fresh but extremely bland, with not much going on besides the pasta and sauce. I guess that's normal for good Italian but I usually enjoy busier dishes. The bread, garlic knots, were actually quite good and I devoured 2, especially dipping in the entree sauces. We were finally given a complimentary olive and pepper dish to start out that was just par. Drinks are expensive and not very good to be frank. I ordered a Manhattan and it was just alcohol thrown into a glass, with no real craft. The house wine is $11 and truly is a house wine. Meal came to around a surprisingly expensive $70. Not worth the cost in my opinion with service underwhelming as well. But nonetheless a strip type of restaurant in downtown Summerlin.

knVGzDmoWnhQQE6w4Efwlw.text: We went to the restaurant at the Venetian this time and it was sooooo good! The service provided by Santina was attentive and well provided. They have a great wine list, a bit pricey by the glass but good. We had the calamari for the appetizer and it was breaded lightly and tasty. We had the eggplant and chicken parmigiana both had pasta and were prepared flawlessly. I highly recommend this restaurant

tgGd0aINr0QDvBMQ2HliRg.text: First time here and had a wonderful experience. We sat at the bar and Bethany was our bartender. Service was spot on. We started with a couple glasses of red wine recommended by Bethany. They were exactly what we were looking for. We only wanted an appetizer to share and Bethany recommended the meatballs. This was a good choice as the meat was flavorful and the pomodoro sauce was divine. At 7pm the live music started and it was a great touch. Hi quality lounge music I would call it.  Great food, great service, great atmosphere. We'll be back soon!

iycjSBIx3SDhLMzVElvW6g.text: Very festiv atmosphere for Christmas shopping, and great Red wine sangria to take the edge off!

vJZYwfGueEdvhg2fNVTuhw.text: Sucks! That was my overall experience! I am sorry! After we have been seated we waited about 10 minutes and no one came to greet us and to take orders!! What!!! We went around 1 PM on a Sunday and they were not even busy at all! I wonder how bad it could have been if they were actually busy! After 10 minutes here came this waitress who looked like just woke up from a nap or something. So unprofessional! She looked like she didn't want to be there!! Wow!! And the food sucked too!! Chicken was so burnt!!! Literally black! And tasted burned! Too small portions felt like its kid's meal or something!!! I will never ever go there again!!

YlMoIAOOseaTmmYcYgfZ0w.text: I prefer other foods than Italian. Pizza is pretty much the most Italian I'll ever eat. I thought pizza is oh well another pizza  But oh no !!!. The pizza I had was outstanding   It's the Quattro Stagioni. Ummm. Yummy.  Ingredients were fresh. Crust perfect.  Our waiter Wyatt  (and no his last name is not Earp) was very attentive. Overall, am visiting AGAIN !!!   Grace & Pete

vcdj7AsPjk-swEcORr6u2g.text: I went here for dinner tonight with my son, and I must say I was not pleased. I ordered gluten free pasta with chicken and no butter. The waiter said that the chicken was going to be dry. I said that I would rather have it be dry than to get sick from all the oil and dairy. When the food came, I was surprised to find out that my chicken was breaded. I don't understand why they would give me breaded chicken with gluten free pasta. The waiter never came back after that, so I tried to take off the bread unsuccessfully and ended up giving the rest of my chicken to my son. He got the linguine with shrimp pasta with a watered down sauce that he said was disgusting. $85 later, I feel like I was robbed and have a stomach ache. I wonder if that pasta was really gluten free. My recommendation is that you don't go here and go to the many other places around.

-lySPKIUKI6DQd8aVTfNkQ.text: Second time here. First time four stars, this time two. It would have been less but Beth came in to save the day! The first time 4 stars due to the horrible tiramisu. This time I would have given 1 star but like I said Beth, the bartender, came in and made the experience so much better with her great personality and social skills. Ricki our "server" was not attentive, OVER charged us, did not bring our antipasto (I had to ask the manager for it). We were there early, at 4pm, when happy hour starts. I recommend waiting until the bartender comes in at 5pm. The restaurant was not busy, there were us and 2 other tables, 6 people total. If you can go Wednesday through Sunday Beth works then, she is amazing. So helpful, always recommending, attentive, pleasant, sociable, etc... Just a fabulous gal all around. This is what I want when sitting at the bar. The kale salad was fabulous, as was the pizza. Last time we were here the Bolognese and calamari was fabulous. The food is outstanding, but Ricki is horrible. If you hate your job, stay home!

3umKJEhDjniNjdRGVDq95g.text: Should have left when we sat down to notice the silverware was dirty and bread plates not clean.  Appetizer of eggplant rotini was actually good but the rest was mediocre.  Arugula with cherry tomato salad was a generous pile of arugula but only 5 halves of under ripe cherry tomatoes.  The waiter recommended the baked ziti with meatballs.  It was swimming in cheese and didn't have much sauce.  That was probably a good thing since the sauce it did have was on the sweet side.  The meatballs with it were bland but ok.  Hubby is a chicken parm addict but he barely touched what they served him, also because the sauce was sweet.  Wine list has nothing under $40.  The wines they have are marked up four times retail.  They were out of the first two bottles we ordered.  The Meomi we buy for $17 in the store is $15/glass or $55/bottle.  Ferrari Cab was $55 too.  Over-priced for a casual spot like this.  We won't go back.

9AeGMYHQG6ekzNmChLzwCA.text: Great service from Ricki, even better food. Be sure to order the calamari. The garlic knots hint at how good their pizza must be. Penne ala vodka had a great, subtile guiancale flavor to it. The Linguine with the white clam sauce was perfectly seasoned in a slightly thick bodied sauce of deep complexity. The clams, in shell, were ocean fresh, impeccably clean and plentiful. The linguine was prepared perfectly al dente. Service was like a light breeze, barely noticeable, but just there and appreciated. Consider re training your hostess, as we requested a quiet table and she attempted to seat us in front of the restroom!

wAf3JBg6DaJCdrWAqffKDg.text: First time here. Amazing food and Bethany at the bar is awesome! Great service and food recommendations. There was a live musician on guitar who was amazing. My wife and I are still here having a wonderful night. Thank you trattoria reggianno!

zfZfpWUY0Ch4JjvlYKxAlQ.text: First time here and we love it. Food was great. I had the gnocchi with Alfredo and side of meatballs. Sam was our waiter and offered great service with a touch of good humor. We will come back.

mxd5y-Bpyk9Od3wxg7ekog.text: One of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas we have eaten at. Not to mention how pleasant and helpful our waitress Rikki was. She helped us to select the perfect meal. We will definitely be back.

p_J-ZhnRwbaVYY6eh4KQDw.text: Me and my wife go there once a week to have a couple of drinks, and a pizza.  The food is very good.  Bethany is a great bartender.  Recently they added live music, which, in my opinion makes the dining experience worse.  The musicians are pretty old, have way too much hair dye, and sing songs that attracts an older crowd.  The sad part is that after a while, the sixty-somethings begin to dance, and let everyone know how drunk they are.  Hopefully they can trim down the number of nights that they have live music.

up2eJEG1yOrCXkZDkJkNrg.text: One of my favorite places to eat lunch in Downtown Summerlin. Rikki is always so attentive and friendly. She knows what I like to eat, and how I like it prepared. Always a great experience.

T_FBpY2Bb4tMYciv_K_Z-A.text: I was really hoping to like this place. I had seen the one in the Venetian many times and it was always crowded. I now realize that that was filled with tourists, most likely one-time only patrons. The food here was kind of flat and monotonous. The marinara sauce is bland. This is a beautiful restaurant if a bit pretentious. I get a sense that this place is run by a heavy-handed egotistical owner or manager that cannot see-through to its problems. I watched the management while I was dining here, and they seemed stern and unaccommodating. Our waiter was very friendly, almost too much so. I will probably try it again, just in case I was there on a bad day. All in all however, I was disappointed.

vAeRYASTRPEqmejL3PgzUg.text: Absolutely love this restaurant. The food and ambiance are fantastic! We usually eat at the bar, No need to even look at a drink menu...we just ask Eli to make us something delicious...and he always comes through with an amazing concoction!!!!!

sejEeRCxVbys_SF9tHCwXQ.text: What a major disappointment!  I ordered penne primavera and it was served sitting in warm water. There was no flavor at all.  I pointed it out to the waiter, who replaced it, and also had it taken off the bill.  The replacement was ok, but not flavorful enough to bring me back.  I truly wonder if the food quality is dependent on who is in the kitchen.  The reviews go from 5 stars to "blah". I also ordered the kale peanut salad which was too acidic for my taste.  The two stars are only for the waiter, "Giovanni" who I would give five stars, but I don't want anyone to think it is for the food.  I think management needs to do a better job on what leaves the kitchen and goes to the table.

gtgyk7hNbl4L3NLjM8ZhJg.text: Had a friend in town and we wanted to go someplace different.  So since she was staying at Red Rock so we chose italian.  Truly great food, good wine selection and a very cool spot with indoor and outdoor seating.  Great service too.  Definitely will go back.

wlchSmWDYLnJP22OkG2-FQ.text: Got food poisoning there last night. Have eaten there before and thought the food was so-so, but never expected to get food poisoning. Threw up 4 times. Had eaten the salmon. Definitely will not be going back. A friend of mine told me her husband got sick there as well. They really need to change what they're doing. The place lacks a "uniqueness vibe" and the food is not commensurate with the prices. Out of all the places to go and eat, I can't imagine they'll survive with the quality they're producing.

bAsGzSWc7SErdjrNVo2bvw.text: Yummy food. Sam was an awesome waiter. The garlic knots were wonderful. The outside sitting area will be a great place to sit in nice weather. Recommend highly.

QgCD8IG2djz-MoaIJHhVNg.text: Had the Shrimp Scampi and loved it!  Great environment and the staff was wonderful. Definitely worth checking out!

E7iB3MMEmW9Iqzv41UyCTA.text: I had baked ziti & the wife ordered the meat balls. Ziti was good, nothing fantastic. Balls were ok. We had the balls at Little Tony's in Palace Station the week before & they were great. We'll try something else next time we're there & give them another chance.

EDYATpMf6Sry9WtoLuIPog.text: One of the best authentic Italian places I've been to! First of all, the food was AMAZING! The pastas were tastefully cooked and the sauces were balanced and delectable. The complimentary garlic knots are to die for, and the other appetizers were great. Next was the service, literally the BEST service I've had in forever! They seated us immediately, attended us just as fast, and the main food courses came out in less than 20 min. They were all extremely friendly and courteous. All of the staff personally greeted us throughout the meal and made sure we were doing fine (it was my first time even entering the restaurant). The ambiance was great as well. Very romantic for a date and the lighting and atmosphere was delightful. We got to hear live music and the tables have crayons and a sheet of parchment over the table cloth for drawing too! For dinner for two the pricing was very reasonable as well. I recommend this place to all of the people I know

cN-2ehxdbBcoUT971lIvfw.text: I have dined at this restaurant a few times now. I have always been very satisfied. The food is absolutely scrumptious and cooked to perfection. My favorites are the meatballs, rollatini, and any of the seafood dishes. Whether dining with my wife or with friends Trattoria Reggiano is an excellent choice.

OsPRPOwuY82wBexfOyrasQ.text: Great food! Everything taste authentic and was so good. Only con is that they put too much cheese on everything which was a bit too much for me. Good food and definitely would recommend.

7B6E45Dj7ggXU59hi__EdA.text: One of my very favorite places to dine ! Delicious Authentic Italian Cuisine,  attentive service and a beautiful atmosphere. My Favorite Mother's Day Dinner choice.  Five Stars

nltGjPJykVaVTkxKJ32GCA.text: Food is great but if you go for Happy Hour and Wed Lady's Nite watch out, things show up on your bill you did not have, unfortunately did not realize until we got home, 3 extra beers at $8 ea and a drink which was supposed to be free, $28.50all toll, sorta thought $108 for Happy Hour was not right but in a hurry to get somewhere after would.

hNytzlEdpbFsOCmmw4vd7A.text: Wow! Great food. Great atmosphere. Do not go there without trying the meatballs, they are fabulous!  Oh, and the service there was the best.

rnbEaVJZkZytQwpHUibz4A.text: This restaurant in Summerlin has a very European / Italian feel.  The servers were friendly and attentive--- especially Tony our main waiter. My friend and I split a lunch and our first course was the Italian kale salad which was more than ample for two people and chock-full of all the ingredients mentioned on the menu.  It was a wee bit overdressed for my taste but still delicious. We then enjoyed the eggplant parm which was very lightly breaded, sauteed and then topped with a hint of marinara sauce and finished off with melted mozzarella and served with a side of Al Dente spaghetti with marinara sauce. We couldn't resist dessert and it's a good thing because we ordered the cannoli which was freshly assembled per order. The filling was amazing; creamy and flavorful and decorated with chocolate chips, yummy.  I would like to return for dinner sometime soon.

s6QwRT6ynWvLnCJNVq1m4w.text: I have dined in at Trattoria Reggiano four time thus far, and I am planning to dine in the next time I am in Vegas. Immediately after arrival, the server will bring fresh bread. I like it so much that I usually request more. I have tried several of their pizzas and pastas. They were all delicious, fresh and amazing. The item I particularly like is the pizza with prosciutto which is hands down one of my favorite pizzas.

IqMviuwEUntpEp6TUfxFiA.text: We've been to Trattoria three times recently and have been so happy every time! The food is amazing and the staff is super friendly and really helpful! Plus the restaurant is nice and the patio is nice as well.  I called on the phone to make a reservation and Angie was really nice and kind, and when we went in, she was just as sweet in person when she was greeting the guests and seating them. The manager Daniel was very, very nice and friendly as well. Our servers were great and very helpful (I have a food allergy so I had some questions), and I really appreciated it!  We can't wait to go back again! :)

XB3Xp4j_1LXxY_uv1N62Sw.text: Absolutely one of the best dinners ever.  Food was prepared perfect. Appetizers were Calimary with marinara sauce and a Caprese Salad, stunning.  I ordered the Shrimp Linguini Marinara with crisp golden French Fries and the wife had USDA NY Steak with Vegetables.  Steak was a beautiful medium rare; vegetables were crisp clean and sauteed perfectly. On to dessert... Tiramisu, Ricotta Cheese Cake, Lemon Sorbet and Gelato... wonderful and an absolute symphony of flavor. You know all the ingrediants, foods and sauces were prepared fresh and with passion.   I would like to compliment the Chef, kitchen staff, servers and Management for outstanding food and service. I will be back with family for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner for the family a friends tonight compliments of Chef Richard.  Love you cousin.

XCU7sEfo9MaRdVY03of7yw.text: My husband is quite Italian and quite picky when it comes to food!! Trattoria is our "stop before the movies" in downtown Summerlin mall. Easy to get to, simply valet at the movies and a few steps your there! Indoor/Outdoor concept and super during this time of year.  Bar is extensive, food has always been amazing and seems like employees love it here because we see the same ole faces :)  Stop by and I would recommend the blackened Ceaser salmon salad for those counting calories + a glass of merlot.  Fun Fact: Did you know the dough for their pizzas are imported from New York!

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can watch your food being prepared!
Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Friendly atmosphere and eclectic feel to the restaurant.

tBO4ZxgaCocsnMHwsR2ouA.text: We arrived at Trattoria Reggiano for a group lunch and from start to finish the meal was anything but exceptional.  The restaurant was pretty empty the entire time, but despite this fact service was not as attentive as I would expect.   We ordered a number of appetizers for the table to share, including meatballs, calamari and caprese salad. I only tried the meatballs and caprese salad, neither of which  were remarkable in the least.   For my entree I decided to steer clear of the pastas and pizzas and offered the salmon with vegetables. Both the vegetables and salmon lacked flavor and I had no desire to eat everything.   The whole table seemed unimpressed with their food so I wasn't alone in my assessment. I don't see myself returning for any reason.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with veggies

Y7z1LB1bVo5GMMHzwL0AOA.text: First time at Trattoria for brunch today . Las Vegas has so many wonderful brunch locations but I have to say that today's meal topped all the ones we've been to  .  We had the Italian Eggs Benedict cooked to perfection .  Perfect amount of hollandaise with eggs that were cooked so they would run once cut into . Fantastic !  Brunch burger smothered in cooked onions , bacon with a fried egg on top . Mmmmm  Pancakes and a wonderful salmon plate to top it off .    We will be back !!  Downtown summerli  Back again and this time was even better than the first . Eggs Benedict , vegetarian omelet , Brunch burger , pancakes she eggs .. caffe latte , coffee ,  4 of are she drank and brought home food for another entire meal for under $90..  well done

j4xt6l5zbytQctzlnc2qmA.text: This is high end for the mall restaurants here, but the nice decor and friendly staff outweigh the food and service. Unfortunately, it's one of those places where they notice your water glass is empty and refill it after you finish your meal and drank 3/4 of the water from the person next to you.   My friend kept trying to ask the server questions and ordering but the server kept walking off where she was getting pretty frustrated. The place was 3/4 full maybe but not overly busy as it was already 7:30.  The whole table heard me ask for shrimp scampi since they had to come back to take my order, except our server so when the food came out I stared at it and thought these are either mighty big shrimp (the menu did say jumbo shrimp) or I got chicken. I ask the server to double check and said server apologized and insisted in making it right. It came out in 6 min. It was fast. I got 6 jumbo shrimp...maybe I should've told them to take their time and cook it for 12 minutes (to get 12 shrimp).  Shrimp was fine but it was overpowered by this stuffing placed on top which was salty and totally out of place. The shrimp was simply overpowered in this case.  The appetizers of calamari and cheese and olives were very good though. The mozzarella pizza was ok but it certainly is no Grimaldis or even Pieology. Yes, I would gladly take the pieology pizza. The pizza is thin slice but the tomato flavor is not there. It can use more sauce or tomato paste. The next day when I reheated it it was soggy due to to much water from the cheese. The lobster ravioli was very good.  It does not stack up against the middle ground Cheesecake Factory in my view. The service is friendly but lacking. For $300 for a group of 7 (not including the bar tab) it was nothing to write home about. Very disappointed as the place looked like a really nice place.

T3kavoZfG71cZIeNPYQGTA.text: Came here for a late dinner with the family after shopping. Very nice ambiance, live entertainment. The service is superb! Ordered a pizza which was suppose to come with ricotta, i appreciated that they handled the situation very professionally. Regardless of the missing ricotta on the pizza they quickly made us a new one to go & we still left as satisfied customers. The only con I had was the price, it was pretty pricey for what it was.

kzhHzZoEACYi4pThuoLjlA.text: Great service from moment we walked in. Daniel greeted us and offered recommendations on their menu items. The recommended bolognese on pasta was phenomenal and more than I could finish . Hilda, as the server was friendly and very responsive. Just in the process of relocating to the area and already have a favorite Italian Restaurant.

Yju_q1CGRNmnbwlJTaLSbQ.text: The service was excellent.   Rikki did a great job.  Started with Eggplant Rolotini.  Moved on to Pasta Fagioli.   Both excellent  Veal Marsala for the entrees.  Very tender and generous portions of pasta.  Ricotta Cheesecake and Cannoli for dessert. Again. Very fresh and delicious.  Very impressed.  Will return.

rhU5YN7P-APLXk0edFMl0A.text: High quality food and service...why can't more restaurants be like TR?

NJPn7iJ7AZMjRw0e0bxDtA.text: My boyfriend and I gave this place a 3 star review solely because of the food. It looked really nice inside and because of our Italian craving, we found this spot to be something new to try. The food was presented wonderfully, but the taste just doesn't match its good looks.  To be honest, this was nothing special. Their food, for the prices that they were, didn't seem to really be worth it. My pasta was mediocre, our pizza was as well.   I think the one thing that stood out was the really friendly customer service from our server for the evening. She was very attentive and accommodating. While we waited for our food she brought us out a little tray of cheeses and olives to snack on.   I don't think we'll find ourselves here again, but it wasn't a bad place. Would I recommend this to anyone else? No, because it wouldn't be the first Italian restaurant to cross my mind, BUT if someone were to ask me if they should eat there, I don't think I would try and dissuade them.

QBRqnVZDLc1kKV7FWEcpPw.text: Came here for lunch on Saturday and to my disappointment was not able to order from the regular menu - which is awesome! The menu was more a brunch menu with eggs a and burgers than it was Italian items I wanted the sausage and broccoli rabe and want able to get it.  Thankfully they let me order the salmon and arugula salad! Bring back the regular menu- at all times!

8LcUeEvMupWjNShdWnZ8yQ.text: Cute Italian restaurant in downtown Summerlin. I believe there is a location on the strip as well but I like this location better.  It has outdoor seating but since it's winter we opted to sit inside. There is a bar inside and as well as an open kitchen.  I started with a glass of wine. The waiter was very helpful in picking a glass of wine. I told him I was ordering penne al vodka and he suggested a red pinot. It was a great pairing! The pasta was also good.  Dessert was, of course, my favorite. We ordered tiramisu and it was the best tiramisu I have ever had. If you order dessert you must try this one.  The prices were moderate. Not overly expensive but not cheap. The service was good but we did have to wait a little while at the end of the check. Overall a good experience. My pick for best Italian in downtown Summerlin.

PnFifj3iERZEH2EKH_vlTw.text: One of my favorite Italian restaurants in Vegas. Great music on the patio. Best garlic knots in Las Vegas. Maybe even the world. I had to break my no carb diet and have one.

raU7VmOSlxONry7OW4xD7Q.text: My family keeps coming back to this wonderful restaurant.   Vito is the best host.  The food is  top notch made from quality  ingredients.  Generous servings.  Excellent service.  Very comfortable  setting.

7HaH2Roj-r8D-_s32cqlDg.text: Took a party of 3 around 8pm last night. Outdoor seating was perfect for the weather. Nice area to eat. However both hostesses were either completely new to the business or new to a customer service job. No smile .... No nothing ... Barking out seating times. The alcoholic drinks were great , the food was average. The server was good and made me feel like I was in New York. Accent attached!! Wouldn't recommend the lobster tortellini.... But the meatballs and spaghetti were great.  Overall .... Would return only in a pinch.

ougrRorY7zRTPX_aIUFR7Q.text: This is an amazing restaurant in downtown summerlin!! Love the open atmosphere enjoying dinner and looking out at the shops. The food is 5 star Italian with great dishes, favorites are chicken parmigiana, pesto gnocchi, and old fashioned spaghetti and meatballs. Bethany at the bar is an amazing server and will keep you entertained with great conversation and good company. This is my favorite spot for dinner go check it out for yourselves!!

MCHh_Il8eqAUK8qi0buDJw.text: We went to grape street in January and let me just say you have it all over them. Our waitress Teressa was wonderful and Mimmo is my new favorite person very classy. The food was absolutely amazing. The garlic knots with the oil and vinegar just wow I couldn't stop eating them. I ordered one of their signature drinks it was delicious we went during lunch time and had the balsamic chicken salad. And also one of their pizzas. I cannot wait to go back for dinner! This is a must place to eat!

iyMmsggaFxaHsKVMPWaW0g.text: Great service, amazing food. I'm Italian and from NY. I would say hands down this is the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas.

pDEBQGs5QrKtvVjes--3AA.text: The food is very good quality and the staff is very happy to accommodate particular requests.  The atmosphere is very nice with nice outdoor terrace seating available.  There is enjoyable live singing entertainment after 7 PM.  I like that it is open at those odd hours between lunch and dinner.  My only complaint-- they don't have dark field green lettuce; if they did, I'd give it 5 stars.

39wy85RgN2rFM-cxEi40sw.text: The food is great but the service needs much improvement. The staff is friendly but need some training to be more attentive. Not enough menus for all guests, water refills are few and far in between, it took a while to figure out who our server was.

9tNGfIHA3f4zkbFt_5WxYQ.text: Very good Italian food and service. I had spaghetti and meatballs and others had ziti. Two kids (3 and 19 months - and the mess associated with them but the staff was great about that) shared ravioli off the kids menu. We dined outside in pleasant weather. Pricing is spot on for what you get. Highly recommended!

QdUPXlmqV46FiCZyPvbwzQ.text: Right now a big thumbs down. Our 20 minute wait has turned into 70 minutes.  Dear hostess learn how to judge time there are right now a good 20 angry people outside and pissed

H8WqbZjUw5HIiaynEEEGjw.text: After a day of shopping I found a wonderful new favorite of mine.  The atmosphere is wonderful and the service is professional and on point.  The food is fresh, and I can't say enough about the meatballs and garlic knots.  They have daily specials that sound wonderful, but I stuck to my favorite pasta with meet Sauce which is made with filet mignon delicious! A must go to spot in downtown summerlin...

Pu-Ghv_wWQC99yqnV16ZqQ.text: We tried their Veal. I had the veal parmagain and my wife had the veal scaloppini. Both were outstanding!  Meatball appetizer was delicious. The desserts were to die for.  Service was excellent! We will be back!

qb4ATBDdxjY1pLZi_MFh9Q.text: What a disappointment, I was really looking forward to trying this place. All the great reviews for mediocre type of Italian food. It was like eating at an expensive version of an olive garden with the same crappie food. Don't know if maybe it was the wrong time or what but I definitely expected a lot more out of it. (Came around 2:30pm) The price is never an issue for me as long as you give great quality food and authentic...none of that here.

MDhkIGng2ecxDTxz47Ja4Q.text: Had a great time this past weekend! Loved their new singer. Beautiful voice! I hope this will be a regular for the weekend. I'm still dreaming about my amazing pizza. Great addition to downtown

02ernlvg9ljNOs5adPOe9w.text: Went here for Valentine's Day on a second date.  The setup was not ideal for relaxing and getting to know someone.  The two tops are INCREDIBLY small and there were were surrounded on both sides by other two-tops, about 8-10 inches away.  I felt claustrophobic and it was uncomfortable to talk because the tables on each side of us could clearly listen in on our conversation. We might as well have all been at one big table together, that's how close we were. They need to spread things out a bit more if they want their ambiance to be better.  Stop trying to squeeze so many people in!  The food was pretty good, I told the waiter I wanted a pepperoni pizza and it came out smothered in kalamata olives and pepperoni ( I absolutely HATE olives!) Not sure why they did that...I did'nt want to complain in front of my date so I just picked them off but all I could taste was olives  :/  Pasta fagioli soup was decent, not the best I've had in the city.  Garlic knots were awesome.

_ZEwrYr32goZguZsUHnZOw.text: My friend and I came here after a day of shopping, it was the first time for both of us. We had a wonderful server by the name of Ricki - we weren't sure what to order and she recommended the lobster ravioli which was what we both ordered and it was fantastic. We then had to have some dessert and our server Ricki recommended her favorite- tiramisu- well now it is my favorite!! So glad we decided to check out this place - will definitely be returning when Ricki is working and asking for her recommendations again!

b4ksgHv-HytavhCoxK2WWQ.text: I love this place..Authentic Italian.  Everything is so fresh..Rickie is an amazing server.  She is one of the reasons we keep coming back..try the Eggplant Rottini as an appetizer.  Great happy hour too....

Gb4U4hwefxuWzW3Btcoyrw.text: Trattoria Reggiano is a great local Summerlin Italian restaurant for causal alfresco dinning. Our bartender and cocktails were fantastic! I love that they allow you to bring your own bottles of wine (for a small pour fee) adds a fun personal touch to the dinning experience. The appetizers and entrees all around the table were on point, well seasoned, excellent portion size and absolutely delicious! This place will definitely be our go-to when in the mood for Italian!

KOYnm4O8Vg_g2uvyJfphcg.text: I'm torn between 2 and 3 stars. I wasn't impressed but I wasn't really disappointed. It's closer to A OK, but I've definitely had better. Everything was just alright. It tries hard but falls short. They do offer complimentary garlic bread and an antipasto plate. The cheese on the plate was not good at all. The olives were eh, and the canned roasted peppers were just that....canned...or jarred..whatever. Not fresh made. So, as much as I enjoy free stuff, I like free stuff thats good. I'd pass on the antipasto next time. There were 8 of us so we tried a bunch of stuff. I really enjoyed the eggplant rolatini, that was so good. The calmari were OK, but I didn't think the meatballs were great the way people raved about them. I ordered the fruit de mare pasta dish. It was alright. I'd try something else next time if I decided to come back. We had a couple of bottles of the sangria (half price during happy hour), and we enjoyed that.  I'm a HUGE fan of eggplant rolatini, and theirs was good, so if I did come back, it would be for that. Service was alright. Cost was what you'd expect for Summerlin. Oh, be mindful of prices. They differ from menu to menu.

j-IdoDmO8Mrmitp1alc2LA.text: Delicious italian dinner.  We had the Filet of Sole Meuniere.  Nice friendly atmosphere.  Live music on the patio.  Very personal staff.  Ask for Sam he is awesome. Great place to relax and enjoy at the Downtown Summerlin mall.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sam

Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious dinner. Filet of Sole Meuniere.  Live music.  Very nice atmosphere and very friendly-personal staff. Ask for Sam, he is wonderful.

lZG2B0-jkpEbfMPZHFmu6A.text: I just finished reading a review of an incident at this restaurant on 8/10/15 written by someone patting himself on the back and being untruthful about what happened.  My family and I eat here quite often.  We love the food and the service.  I don't know what place the writer was in but this restaurant doesn't have 15 people working on any shift.  When the lady fell, the bartender (who was an EMT) immediately rushed to her.  At the same time, one of the servers was doing exactly what she should by calling mall security.  The "gentleman" really didn't have to do anything since the staff was very knowledgeable about the appropriate actions to take and took them.   I very seldom write anything on Yelp, but I do read reviews of places we want to try.  It really bothers me when someone writes inaccurate reviews.  That is not to say that things can't be wrong at times with food and service. However, let's at least be honest.  The food at this restaurant is not New York Italian, but rather, True Italian from Italy.  It is authentic and excellent.  The servers, bartenders, and manager are always helpful, polite, and accommodating.    I have tried to correct an injustice by explaining the event and stating our enjoyment every time we dine here.

VqLybysn0PqIi-ATMEbVqQ.text: This is the absolute best restaurant!  The food is outstanding, the service is amazing and they have the best bartender ever - Bethany!  Truly every dish I've ever had was out of this world!  The meatballs - you'll never want them from anywhere else.  The Italian Kale Salad - you'll be craving it for days.  The cheesecake and carrot cake - wear pants with elastic waistbands because you'll be licking the plate clean.  This restaurant is a must when friends/family come to visit.  Come, enjoy!!

7m3cmXGsw6vbbRVoA4DKvg.text: I've been here several times and they continue to impress! With the customer service being top notch, and the bartender ( I think her name is Bethany) the food, atmosphere, and all the people are very friendly! The food is delicious and my fave is the lasagna!!! You cannot go wrong in here!

tBvKbjT8JoMFJNtl6a5G4A.text: Great food, pizza  drinks amd service Moscow Mule was excellent and Garlic bread appatizer / olives awesome!!.. I had eggplant Parmesan which was good but the sauce was very Sweet boarding on A Chef Boyardee vibe!! The entertainment and outdoor patio is a nice bonus at DTS.. Hey Trattoria please just overhaul your red sauce and you got the 5th star!!

XsLw4nJ9kE_hhX2iOxB3jw.text: Wonderful evening !  Food was delicious, steamed clams, eggplant parm, fettuccine, chicken Marsala. Rosanna, Friday's entertainment, WONDERFUL. upcoming, Diana Krall, Michael Buble style.  Casual yet very special evening. Outdoor eating, fabulous weather. PERFECT EVENING.

zGhnWj0OzkEVNONw6kavgg.text: We ate on the patio on late Sunday afternoon.  It took quite a while for the waiter to come to our table.  The drinks came fast.  The garlic knots were just ok and took forever.  They were dripping with butter.  I like butter, but it was too much for me. The food showed up 30 seconds after the bread finally showed up. We had spaghetti with meatballs which was good but overpriced and a chicken dish, which was good.   The server never checked back and took forever to get the bill much less offer dessert.

_iBmeh3BE1VLD7J4TTuipg.text: Recently visited here on a date night. Restaurant was very busy and service was quite good. We had an appetizer of calamari, pizza di Parma and I had the Veal Francese with pasta. The calamari was pretty good, pizza was good and the veal was just meh. There was an odd taste to the sauce on the veal and the veal wasn't as tender as I'm used to. The real reason for the low review is based on the price. If you're going to charge nearly $40 for a plate of pasta then the dish had better be spectacular. Our meal was $75 for two entrees and an appetizer (we drank water) and the food was anything but special. I can't see coming back with those prices to try anything else.

J9_3r7QRUG2vy0MTcP25WQ.text: Great food and great service by great people.  Definitely a must to dine in at Downtown Summerlin.

iB9G0TDKOU0DX--d1uKoJw.text: Really good food!!!  Gf pizza was awesome.  Crust was crisp and sauce excellent.  Chicken parmigiana was super good.  Caesar salad was amazing.  We'll be back here for sure

s1mNtLjJo0dSXSLn4l9EGQ.text: The garlic knots are massive and so delicious! The pizza was pretty good, I got the Salame Piccante - Pepperoni but I've never seen garlic knots so big in my life and I'm kind of in love with them now.

-dK4J5TIgQe6fQi1s7GZwQ.text: The food here was very nice and the service was second to none. But never order a glass of wine you will only get a quarter glass at $11 for a Zinfandel. Not good. And the food also is a little high someone has to tell them that they are not on the strip. This is my second time there and I will return after I get a loan from the bank. LOL. Give it a try just bring a little extra cash. The first time I came here I love it and still do. I just don't remember it so pricey.

JTfWdfjJtnnapE1pBVOUaA.text: Food was good but service was terrible. Took over an hour to get our food. I don't suggest coming here unless you have three hours of spare time to eat a half decent italian meal.

mpxR_McPtpsGwEocmjZHWw.text: We frequent this place. It's located in Downtown Summerlin and is next the the Regal 5. The eggplant appetizer is the best! We also like the pizza. Everything we have tried has been good. The service isn't the best but not bad enough to not go back.

q0h19okDxIoS7JRPd2-nPw.text: Good food, and they had a little music setup on the patio.  Nice place to people watch, although a bit hot with this Vegas weather.

kaD-1vQ_KaguPQuVq7CD8A.text: Came here with my boyfriend last night and we had a great experience! Everyone was very nice, service was fast and friendly. We had the calamari to share and it was really good. I got the carbonara and my boyfriend got the linguine in clams. Everything was very good, will definitely come back soon for another date!

4MSMyuEGkj5uj7_0kcHyXQ.text: Wonderful dinner place! Delicious food great outdoor seating, good service. Definitely recommend!

y7bxi9EOnTLaNLKdHLCQgw.text: Wow ! Had dinner there again last night . The bar was hoping and the drinks were flowing . Jennifer the bartender followed me around the bar and offered me a drink when there were no seats .  They've added live music and added several new dishes . My wife had the Dover sole and I had the veal Milanese .  Both were generous portions and excellent. Highly recommended !!!  Just an update to my previous review . We visited this establishment again this week and probably had the best eggplant appetizer . Perfectly cooked covered in delicious red gravy and cheese . Mmm Best of all was the service , ambiance and of course the prices .  It's the most authentic Italian restaurant in town .

2XPrnUdQjYaIu2n8MbeF0w.text: I ordered Fettucino Alfredo to go. For the low, low price of just $25, I got a 2 scoops of noodles in a tin container - no parmesan, no cutlery, no napkins. Adding insult to injury, the pasta was undercooked. A travesty by all measures... if someone DOES want to have a relaxing meal in the restaurant, they would have to try to find a spot that doesn't have sports TV's as a feature. Nice music and decor but really? The TV's are in poor taste. But then, so was the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Does this look like a Fettucine Alfredo you would enjoy? You could have the experience for just $25. Oh - bring your own cutlery &amp; napkins.

aQqCBSwuXxSXXC_KINt9vg.text: 2.5/5.  Atmosphere was great, bread was DELISH, service was abysmal.  I couldn't hate on the entree though but our meal was over $100.  Good experience but not worth going back to.

qP6rTNClZQFg8Q4EIshh6g.text: Celebrated my birthday with a friend.  It was my first visit.  I am a fan.  We shared a pizza, it was a very generous in size.  And very tasty!  But, what I really want to rave about is the service  we received from everyone.  The server, the bartender, the host were outstanding.  They have a lovely outside seating area with coolers so we were not hot at all.  A big thumbs up, can't wait to go back again.

zm898lh4djchdUp_gLZbDQ.text: This place has the best pasta in Summerlin! Ask for Ricki to be your waitress, she'll give you top notch service!

6YhCMKFfacWHZuSDk-7DTw.text: First off....our server here Giovanni....enhanced our dining experience. He's old school and excellent. we felt very comfortable eating here....sat "outside"(under cover) with nice fans making it feel unbelievably comfortable. Its not noisy...pleasant surroundings. Oh, the food? very good. I had my first Negroni to start... impressed. Son had an excellent Manhattan..wife had a nice pour pinot. Wife and I split the Caesar salad--very good. Son had the pasta fagioli and loved it. I had the chicken parm with spaghetti..no complaints. Wife had the filet of sole francais and said it melted in her mouth. My son had rigatoni and meat sauce and said it was cooked perfectly. The garlic knots they give you are very tasty and just out of the oven fresh. Not fancy or pretentious...just a solid spot for a good traditional Italian meal.

amZPQr81Jlkc_KtDbQ2fGg.text: What a surprising find! In a location where the majority of restaurants just settle for average betting on shopper traffic, this spot gives you an experience. Though seemingly pedestrian, the Caesar Salad with Chicken is hands down one of the best I've ever had - The chicken is cooked perfectly and the anchovies are substantial and delicious. The garlic bread is amazing, hot, buttery, soft...so good. The tortellini are delicious as well, clearly handmade and full in flavor. Even, their meatball dish comes dangerously close to Raio's most iconic item. But by far the best thing to order here is dessert, particularly the ricotta cake and cannoli. My last four experiences here have been fantastic!

oM7PQdHXFnB01sLTq9mUug.text: The broccoli rabe was one of the best menu items...now it's gone  Why do restaurants remove great selling items?  I used to buy a few of these to go!  No one cooks it like you they did

0ipzh5iUn43YW7eqA4Za0A.text: We love this restaurant and eat and drink at the bar just to see Bethany. She is the best of the best. Great service, great personality and she makes this place sparkle. Food is always great. We are here at least once a week. Like an upscale Cheers!

Ad6hKz8BW142QgCD-yrgvw.text: Great spot!! To have dinner we shared the Ceasar salad , meat balls and baked ziti!! Delicious I'm just saying.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Olives-Parmesan cheese
Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

a7u_DIjJh6YEYpII7KRuyA.text: Update...   I can understand the owner's response. I probably wouldn't feel good either with not so good reviews... bottom line is that one gives one's honest opinion. Ok, chef is Italian... so what? Besides I'm not the only one giving 2 stars...  Why would someone say its wonderful when it's mediocre? ... no I won't go back... :-)

AcRetvduICUP99aKabr0RA.text: Came in for Valentine's Day. Greeted with a rose and brought to our table as soon as we got in. We had the Calamari, Chicken Parm, and Eggplant Parm, then Cannoli for dessert, all absolutely delicious. Complimentary glass of Champagne with our dessert. A live singer was performing right below the TV, which had sports on, so both me and my boyfriend were very pleased with the entertainment. Wonderful, romantic evening!

VWvZSwTefZUjEm95IPRRLQ.text: I think it all started out on a bad note and there wasn't a recovery during our visit.   Asking guests to wait outside until a table inside is ready (aka 108 degrees) while there is only 1 other table of 4 seated in the restaurant (should have been my first clue) is a bad start. Being pressured to order= I really hate that. It was my first time here,  I needed some time. I was also confused why the host is asking for my order minutes after we sat down? If your host is going to take orders, they should know the specials of the day! Alright, so that was an awkward start...  They bring Garlic knots that are generous and appear very appetizing. Overly greasy, soggy in olive oil, a raw garlic flavor; lighter on the oil and some nice crisp on the bread would be a big improvement.  Fella ordered the meatball sandwich (comes with fries); I went with a Caesar salad because I was already suspicious. (AKA: servers and line cooks talking about their dates last night loudly by my table in a big empty restaurant, doesn't make me feel like kitchen is strong on their game). Our food arrived so quickly I was surprised and a little suspicious (microwave?); the cheese appeared oddly coagulated, melted but not bubbly like a nice toasted meatball sam.  The salad- flavorful dressing but overdressed and I wasn't a fan of the full anchovy presented on top. Top it off- last bite was a sour tomato. Trying to eliminate that flavor from my mouth, I took some fries from my fella's dish, and sure enough the oil had a strange taste. I couldn't get the strange oil taste of my palette from these fries.   My favorite things from the experience were the fresh flowers on the table and the Andes mint that finally neutralized the weird fry oil taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball Parm sandwich and fries lunch
Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad

SiH8QBZSRAYIFOGUP7i7IQ.text: I rarely give a 5 but this is well-deserved. Let's start with the food: perfection in every sense! We ordered pizza and pasta and it was tasty and cooked perfectly. We were really pressed for time and our server Bethany went the extra mile to expedite our meal. She topped it off with a considerate lighted cannoli to celebrate my wife's birthday. We will definitely return here on our next trip to Vegas. If you are willing to drive a little ways off the strip, this restaurant is well worth the trip. The places near the strip are over-priced and commercial, not to mention mostly terrible! I'm Italian and have traveled to Italy a few times in recent years. I would put Trattoria Reggiano at par with any place in Italy for taste and authenticity. Friendly and fabulous. Try it!!

EA9xkgAgMAjvVM8V2DkH_w.text: I love this place. Plain and simple. The food is fantastic, the service perfect, and the atmosphere welcoming. The party I went with all got different entrees from the menu and we shared them. Everything was good, and we couldn't agree which entree was the best. I loved the pasta a la vodka, my wife loved the linguini Bolognese, and my brother loved the tortellini alfredo. Bottom line it was all great. Be careful though, I highly recommend saving room for dessert. The cheesecake is one of the best I've ever had, and the tiramisu was delicious. On top of all of this or server made great recommendations, was extremely friendly, and made us excited to return again. The manager introduced herself to us and chatted with us for a minute. It was a wonderful dining experience and I can't wait to come back and try more items from the menu.

af6m5o468KCJIODgbyaAQg.text: Long time Las Vegas resident (over 33 years) and must say this is a wonderful place. Great food, terrific ambiance and service. Never had a disappointing meal from pizza's to spaghetti and meatballs, seafood, and more. Great bread, olives and peppers to kick things off.  Thanks!

-qBXyeXdMbpZb6dDuwMpfA.text: A trattoria is an Italian-style eating establishment, less formal than a ristorante, but more formal than an osteria. There are generally no printed menus, the service is casual, wine is sold by the decanter rather than the bottle, prices are low, and the emphasis is on a steady clientele rather than on haute cuisine.  The above is Wikipedia's definition of a trattoria.  Some of it fits what we experienced at Downtown Summerlin Reggiano.  I'll start with the positive.  At the end of our ordeal Danny the manager refused our payment with apologies.  It would have been about $200. I did tip accordingly.  It was a birthday celebration and our small party of three chose to try something new that a trusted friend raved about, Trattoria Reggiano.  We had reservations and we were seated promptly.  But I should have guessed what was to come when our table, covered with the traditional sheet of meat wrapper, came with a can of crayons.  Our attentive server (Dan, not the manager) was prompt and pleasant. He brought menus which are printed with impossibly small print.  He took our drink orders (wine, martini and water) and soon returned with a basket of the wonderful garlic buns.  Fifteen minutes later, still no beverages.    We were seated near the bar and I could see the person behaving like a bartender wondering about the trattoria, bussing tables and socializing with the foursome at the table next to ours.  I could also see Dan giving her furtive glances to see where the drink order was.  He feared returning to our table because he knew we would also ask.  In the meantime a woman brough her very young daughter to the bar area and said, "Wouldn't you like to sit on the stool that (famous Golden Knights hockey player) sat in the other night?"  Hey, isn't there a law prohibiting minors from sitting in a bar area?  As a bartender or manager I would be nervous about risking my permit over such an infraction, I don't care if you are the Duchess of Summerlin.  In the meantime the bussers would come around the corner with a load of dirty dishes, silverware and glasses which then would be unceremoniously dumped with an accompanying cacophony of disturbing noise.  I'm European and I can tell you that such behavior in Italy would have been the cause of immediate dismissal of that employee.  Finally, Dan came over, apologized for the slow cocktail service and pressed the barmaid to produce our order.  The water came first followed soon by the glass of wine and my martini.  I ordered a martini up.  It was in a stemmed glass, but it had ice cubes in it.  Hello?????  I passed it off as sloppy pouring and said nothing.  By this time we had put in our entree order and waited...and waited...and waited.  I ordered another martini.  It was served identically only with more ice cubes.  Not the way I have ever had a chocolate espresso martini.  More than an hour after entering the premises it occurred to me that the can of crayons were there to help pass the time.  Maybe some doodling, hangman, anything to take our minds of our growling tummies.  I must say that the food is prepared in generous proportions.  Our order included a Caesar Salad and Dan advised wisely, that one order would feed two and offered to split it on two plates.  It came on one and we did the honors.  My pasta dish with meatballs lasted two additional meals after take out.  The food was slightly on the bland side.  In the meantime, I observed Dan and the other working server (only two for the whole place).  He was quite industrious working his tables but the holdup in the kitchen made that a challenge.  His serving associate however, was another story.  She would disappear for lengthy periods.  Twice I watched her go out the front door to talk on her cell phone while customers were waiting for service.  I'm assuming she was mining for another job.  After nearly two hours we just wanted to get out of there and none of us finished our food.  Took awhile to wave down Dan for the check and the to go containers.  He apologized for the slow service and we acknowledged his apology by briefly expressing our disappointment.  He asked if "The Birthday Boy" would be interested in a dessert.  This was the fourth time he used that moniker with me and my 71-year-old child within was about ready to bop him one.  I just said, "no".  Soon after Danny the manager came back with our check and  acknowledging that they had staffing issues.  He assured me when I asked that my drinks should not have been served over ice.  When it was obvious that even when offered a free meal we would never be back, he withdrew the check.  Kudos to him.  There are too many good places in this town to put up with that kind of service.

8RL-2cKxg_yKBeg-tp3nqw.text: Where to start ....   Ok took about 15 minutes for someone to come see me... no biggie . I'm dining alone and enjoying listening to the live music ... someone comes takes drink order and then takes food order. I order a Caesar no tomatoes ... get my salad and notice there are no crouton or anchovies on my salad. am told well they saw no tomatoes and figured you didn't want anything else !?  Interesting I ask if he wants to take my salad to get them to toss my salad says no I'll bring the other items on the side and you can put them on yourself . and well ok then.  As I'm eating the salad I essentially made for myself. someone asks if they can have a seat from my table - mind you there are other empty tables in the area - You know what ... sure why not ... server came to my table a total of 4 times ... 2 of those times were to bring croutons and then the anchovies - yes separate trips .. best thing about my meal was the cocktail .. they made a perfect cosmopolitan . the pink sauce on the lobster ravioli was good ... really flavorful and actually overpowers the lobster... but I would still rate the dish a 3 out of 5  overall a lackluster experience ... I would consider maybe coming here again ... but I'm kind of torn ... it was a relatively slow Thursday night ...

Kcxr3pix7DEAy0NfkTQrDg.text: This restaurant is located at the Summerlin mall which makes it a very convenient location after a long day of shopping. In the summer time the ambiance is even better as you can sit on the outside patio. The price point is reasonable, you can find several dishes priced from 18 to 40 dollars per plate.   They also have a large selection of items so there is not an issue finding anything you would like. The size portions were very generous, I would say most people would have a hard time finishing their plate. I ordered the Lobster Ravioli which was very good. There were large pieces of lobster all over the dish. The sauce was tasty and the ravioli was perfectly cooked.   If you are looking for a simple but tasty dish I would recommend this dish. Overall, the food was good but not memorable.

I never had to ask for refills, she just always made sure I had everything I needed. The pizza was delicious, cappuccino was also very good, but the tiramisu probably made the whole meal great! 9YDp6EqiwNDJq1CGXDuG-g.text: The food and service are amazing! Also, they have amazing entertainment!! I've been there several times and will definitely be back! Love it!

Ch-JY3uwpBa-GNgX4CYsAw.text: This place a excellent! The spaghetti and meatballs were the best I have ever had. The staff were very nice and helpful. My husband and I both enjoyed the food and we will definitely be back again!

JMmGWzrojizvXBQ0apRivg.text: Service is amazing and the food is so good.  The meatballs are literally the best I have ever tasted.  The garlic knots taste like heaven.  My favorite dish is the penne in vodka sauce.  This restaurant is a must eat at!

2Oj0xjljxbwk6FAIq6p_Yg.text: The Caprese appetizer isnt something traditional but the cheese was delicious. The tortelloni alfredo was good. The waiter checked on us periodically and they brought a complimentary veggie/cheese dish which was ok. The garlic bread was never replenished that was given in the beginning. The calamari smelled awful - too fishy. I wanted meat with my dish and they couldnt add it for extra. I had to buy meat balls on the side just to pair it with something. My friend's spaghetti and meat balls were plain sauce wise and my other friend's white wine pasta dish was not appetizing at all. Ended up spending almost $200 between the 3 of us. There was definitely nothing special about this place. I dont mind spending good money on quality italian but I think its more hype than anything else. Overall mediocre. I dont think Id come back again. Im usually not a complainer/nit picker but for someone who loves Italian food and doesnt mind forking out the money it was a big let down.

QxXq-rhQ9V1PU07D7y_Rbg.text: Cute patio with air!! I wish DT Summerlin wasn't such a concrete jungle- too hot even before summer has heated up. Good was quite tasty and service was good. Not sure about the free garlic knots with oil and balsamic for dipping? They were already pretty oily. Portions look small for lunch but don't be deceived, it was more than enough food but a little pricey for lunch. I had pasta with garlic, olive oil and cracked red pepper. The chef forgot to add the pepper and the waitress failed to notice so I had to ask for them to bring a shaker to the table. Simple flavors are an indicator of a chefs skill and the pasta was perfect and the sauce flavorful (can't believe they forgot an ingredient though). I'll definitely give them another chance- when summer is over ;)

SusYcP9bofqRS0rAKJ_Xrg.text: This place is amazing! The food was delicious! I've had the chicken parm, baked ziti, fettuccine Alfredo, lasagna, and spaghetti. So good! cD4-6dBnnIzvmStU8bdyZg.text: Great place, great service and authentic Italian fare. The fresh bread is outta site!!

KZluJ56LnhZU8WeNdLTEdw.text: Awesome, awesome!!! Truth be told I already cooked dinner for myself and my other half tonight, yet I found myself stuffing my face with delicious meatballs! We were out and about shopping and my BF wanted something sweet, I was in support of a restaurant so I could have a glass of wine. The restaurant is very intimate, which I love!! They offer outdoor seating, another plus, plus a great happy hour. We decided to share the spaghetti and meatballs and let me tell you, hands down best meatballs in Vegas. My BF grew up in a very strict Italian family and he could not stop talking about how great the meatballs are. We have no desire to go to another Italian restaurant in Vegas. We of course got our something sweet in the end where my BF chose the Carrot Cake and I went for the Cannoli. Both were amazing!!!! Danny G. the manager helped me to decide to order the Cannoli since he was bragging about how good it is and that they make it fresh in house, SOLD!!! Danny G. was a delight who went over and beyond any expectations to make a casual stroll into dinner #2. Thank you all for a fabulous time!!

VbZop1KtQYEG_qiV1fyASg.text: Great tasting food that even my kids enjoyed!!!. We had a Caprese salad for our appetizer that was great. Some of the freshest basil and creamiest cheese ever. The garlic knots are hot and fresh and with the complimentary cheese, olive and marinated peppers, a great start. Our entrees were piping hot, great taste and filling. We had chicken parmesan, baked ziti and meatballs. All were fantastic. Desert was great !  Finally found a good cannoli and Tiramisu. The price point is a little high, but the location has to be factored in.My only complaint is that my wife substituted whole wheat pasta and charged $2.oo without letting us know. I would pay , but just let me know.

skLoMa9QfUQ0cvQ4fWOXeA.text: My husband and I were vacationing in Vegas and our friends said don't leave Vegas without going to Trattoria Reggiano.  We trust them so off we went for lunch today.  Our waitress, Ricki was so friendly and helpful  we asked for her recommendation.  I had soup and my husband had lobster ravioli. OMG food was fantastic but Ricki made our meal extra special.  Besides being helpful with our food choices she is friendly and never got annoyed with our numerous questions.  When we were ready to leave we hugged Ricki, by then we felt like she was family.  We will recommend this restaurant to everyone who goes to Vegas and it is a must to have Ricki as their server.  We will be back.  Ricki is a definite asset to this business and deserves kudos.

bNm1Ee5MPzcbVv34gidmgg.text: Very nice restaurant. My lobster ravioli was awesome. Great service, they don't rush you.  Restaurant is very busy, so call before to book a table.

YUXugIEQ7_X5GrwPWfSsbg.text: My husband and I had a great time here. We came here on a rare, childless Thursday night and had a wonderful meal. We ordered the eggplant rollatini to start, which was wonderful. We were pleasantly surprised when they brought out garlic knots as their bread and an amuse bouche of Parmesan hunks, olives and roasted red pepper slices. I had to deliberately not fill up before my entree came out. I ordered the tortelloni and they were perfection. Delicate, flavorful perfection. I speculate that they hand make them because of how well they were cooked. My husband had the gnocchi and he thoroughly enjoyed that dish. We will definitely be back. I look forward to bringing my 8 year old foodie next time.

3uOdTl7_gA9BlL7CPGzDIw.text: What an amazing place. Spectacular Italian food. Chicken Parm and Cheese Ravoili is our go to dinner. Wendy the GM is a dream and treats you like family. Bethany tends bar and is the sweetest person we have met since moving to Las Vegas. Always friendly and goes out of her way to make every visit the best part of the day

dEbUSbRBbnis7NmiOptC4w.text: The best thing you might eat here are the garlic knots. I think I came close to eating two baskets worth all by myself. I didn't care if I wreaked of garlic or that I'd be sweating it out of my pores the next day, they were pretty damn good. As for the rest of the stuff I tried... meh. The menu is typical Italian-American food, the kind of stuff you'll see in a million other spots. Perfect for the non-adventurous eater -- the kind of diner who thinks not eating at a national chain is a bit risky.   The kitchen plays it safe and turns out unremarkable food. Meatballs ($14) made from a filet mignon and pork loin mixture were too hard and dense with a sauce that lacked depth. The small portion of the kale peanut salad ($8) was plenty to share, but the underdressed dish had me reaching for water to wash it down. The end of the meal took a turn for the better with a satisfying, but uninspired, lasagna ($22) with ground filet, ricotta, and mozzarella.  Kid menus are available as well. My son's spaghetti (ordered sans tomato sauce, just butter) was a sizable portion that he devoured. Each kid's meal comes with a beverage and mini cannoli.  Located steps away from the movie theater in Downtown Summerlin, it's a nice looking space with a large patio and a smaller than expected interior, with a bar and open kitchen. The food is more paint-by-numbers than Monet, but is just good enough to satisfy a suburban customer base used to eating recognizable Italian.  2.5 Stars

wr7RnGCx-P4WZPv7Yo3yEg.text: This place gets a solid 5 stars. Excellent setting, both times I've been there's live music, and he's actually good. They have these fucking off the hook garlic knots that are literally the best things ever, THAT THEY GIVE YOU FOR FREE. The food, while some may be a tad expensive, is amazing in every aspect; presentation, taste, freshness, etc...  And honestly, the absolute best part, is the service. The waiters are the fucking shit. Dined last night with Hilda, I believe, and she's amazing. Super accommodating, I'm an asshole that modifies everything, and she had an answer for every question I had.  Believe the hype. Way dank.

_PI9aApeHJvRSktWK5jxEQ.text: New to Vegas, so I'm still exploring all the good spots to eat. Seeing I love italian food, I had to try it here. They didn't have my favorite dish which is chicken piccata but they did have my second which is shrimp scampi so that is the only reason they got 4 stars and not 5 stars.   I started my meal out with their steamed mussels, hot cheesy rolls and with oil and balsamic vinegar on the side. Then ordered their shrimp scampi, the shrimps were larger and cooked to perfection. The pasta tasted awesome with the lemon butter sauce.   They also have a bar where you can come just get a drink and watch a game or something.   The service was on point and they made sure you had everything you need, not pushy at all. Sonic your ever in Vegas and want some Italian food, I recommend you come here.
