KoulPyWRKo4EO14P-CD2Uw.text: My first review of this restaurant was in October after we went with some friends and everything was delicious.  Well not so this time.  While the service was good it was not as good as last time.  Last time they brought out a plate of cheese, roasted peppers and red, green and black olives that were fantastic.  This time there was only one of those green olives on the plate and when I asked the waiter for the more and for the other colors he found a few more green ones and said that was all there were which I find hard to believe.  Last time the garlic knots were wonderful.  This time they were very doughy and undercooked although very brown on top.  I had the same meal, baked ziti and while last time it was delicious this time I could hardly eat it.  The other meals were just ok.  Nothing to rave about like our last visit.  Towards the end of our meal they sat a very large party behind us although there really wasn't enough room and the waitress kept bumping into me every time she had to get through.  At one point she told me I needed to move my chair in.  If we were not getting ready to leave I definitely would have said something.  I also think that either the prices went up or they have a higher priced menu because it is during the holidays but I can tell you that we probably will not be going back there.

omGMg1WcQBxt-hbeqt5nYA.text: Loved it!! Great spot. We got a 50% off entree coupon at Tix4Today-- you spend $3/person to get the coupon, but it certainly helped us save. Garlic knots were to die for, penne vodka was some of the best I've had-- smooth and silky sauce dente pasta. The Caesar was a little over dressed, but the dressing was good so I can't complain. Nice service.   The only thing I'd say is that for the Venetian the "views" aren't great. It's situated right near the food court adjacent to a gift shop. They did a nice job with the decor and adding some green shrubs to shield a bit. And the prices were very reasonable (all pastas were $15-$22, chicken parm $26, small Caesar $8) so for us the small tradeoff was worth it.   We will definitely be back if we are in Vegas again!

xWYruMofZkAOT-caV-OU7w.text: This was the second  time a this restaurant.  The first visit was better-better food and service. This time the food was mediocre, at best, not sure if the chef was having an off night.  But our server was very out of it. She seemed like she was doing us a favor by stopping by.  We had to ask for more water, coffee, etc.  She seemed put out when we wanted to look at the dessert menu.  Not sure if we will try again as it is somewhat of a drive and there are great Italian restaurants in the Henderson area.

o8Pzw47gi4eTbMw1qF1cFA.text: Went to dinner here last night with a group of 5. This place is set up as high end Italian restaurant, the spaghetti and meatballs are $22. With this said, we had to ask multiple times for glasses of water and were told the long wait was due to not having enough glasses cleaned. Two of the five dinners were wrong and instead of redoing them they simply brought new incorrect sauce on the side. The bread was cold by the time we received it and half of it burnt. The live music was great but management has some work to do with service and good quality especially with the prices being so high.

Cx2HFibmhEpzKqle1ecuHg.text: We stopped in here for a glass of wine before our movie. We ended up having 4 glasses total, two of which were on happy hour. I will preface this by saying that I did not look specifically at the prices of the wine or the specifics of the happy hour specials. Our bill came to $60! Needless to say I was shocked. I could have gotten 4 bottles (of the same wine) at Costco for that price!! I really do love the atmosphere and have enjoyed their food in the past.  I would go back but definitely recommend checking out a corking fee or have your wine before you go!  The manager stated the pricing is related to the night rental on retail space at this complex.

My friend along with other customers bragged about the meatballs made with steak. My girlfriend raved about the lobster ravioli in a cream sauce with chunks of lobster. Du0OOtcau054gyJl07Zgbg.text: Amazing first experience here tonight. I brought an out-of-town guest so I was looking to make a good impression, it did not disappoint.  Danny was our server and Ricky worked along with him to make sure our drinks were never empty and we had everything else we needed. nHzxijT1IG1wZyj40_heSw.text: Maybe I didn't order the right thing. Maybe they were having an off-day. Or maybe...I was just excited to catch up with my friend I just picked the first thing I saw on the menu.  I came here on a Saturday evening. Surprisingly....parking was easy to find. I saw plenty of parking spaces in the lots AND in the garage.   I ordered the Linguine Bolognese-ground beef with some kind of tomato sauce, fresh herbs and spices, tossed with light Parmesan. It SOUNDS delicious but really, it was a let down. Wasn't very flavorful and tasted bland. Too much pasta but not even meat sauce. Also....this restaurant is pretty pricy for what it's really worth. $22 freakin dollars for my entree. If you want to add chicken, shrimp etc....it's like $6 extra. For this kind of price...I could have gotten a much better quality dinner at Bootlegger Bistro!! Ugh.... =/

Extct739PtteMEigc2zeVA.text: Yummy food. Great for dinner before a movie. Pizza was amazing. Service exceptional.  Love meeting friends on the patio during spring and fall.

k5SUiHrCG8tFRrdQVs3cLw.text: It was a Wednesday and we took my older sister to Dave & Buster's. Their happy hour didn't start until 9 and we were hungry so we decided to look for somewhere to eat nearby. Of course we checked yelp and this place drew our attention. It looks rather small on the inside, there was a bar, and outside seating. It was a nice night so we decided to go with the outdoor tables. We got seated right away and the atmosphere was really nice. There was live music and the lady who was singing was awesome. She made the experience really fun and enjoyable. My sister and I wanted to share so we ordered the specialty salad and a pasta. The waitress brought us garlic knots to start, delicious and soft!!! Don't forget to dip it in the oil and vinegar. The salad came out right after and it was huge! Enough to feed three people. They also split the pasta into two bowls for us (how nice, we didn't even ask). The food was tasty we finished it all and it was very filling. We enjoyed this place very much.

IPJ8af04FZqZtCpRj6uNag.text: A nice place, seated promptly. Hida was our service, and was okay.  We had to wait a while for one of the party took a long time to find parking. RXzko_DH6OtsBSAZI7Y_hQ.text: We came in for lunch mid week and the overall experience was great! We were seated very quickly and our service was very good. We started off with some calamari (great). wa-QspM-7cnMtdp8Gn2kJw.text: This place was great! I would honestly love to come eat and work here. Lobster ravioli was genuine and the sauce was top tier. I give the chefs my props and respect because the service was quick and did not lack quality at all. I will be eating here again soon! My new favorite spot. 97vVV8vh5pqpVC-MOnry2A.text: I had been here previously and had a good visit. I had hoped for a good second visit.  I made a reservation on OpenTable. We came in for our reservation. The hostess pointed to our table which was right next to the door. It was a drafty cold day. I asked the hostess to move to another table. We pointed to several empty tables (at least 5) and were told each and every one of them was reserved for a larger party. While I understand saving room for bigger groups, the lack of accommodation was appalling. We decided to go to another restaurant at that point. As we were leaving, we heard one of the waiters comment loudly "oh wow" to us. This left me not wanting to return again.

7AikilKtK2Jh4iw1ch54Hg.text: Love this spot! Great bar and patio vibes for the spring/summer. Their happy hour is awesome and Beth is the best bartender around! Definitely recommend.

WiUm0uQBXEXAEr_Ev5-4Zw.text: Outstanding in every way! All the staff were extremely friendly. The server Jason, allowed us as much time as we needed to make decisions. I ordered a dirty martini it didn't arrive dirty ( mistakes happen) I just wanted some olive juice on the side to mix in my martini, but Jason insisted on taking it back and getting it shaken again so it was cold again. All the food came out hot and in a timely manner. We ordered meatballs, calamari, Caesar salads, linguini with clams and it all was excellent. Some friends who live here took me here because they love it and I can see why. Even the bathrooms are sparkly clean. Our water, tea, and wine were never empty and we were always asked if we'd like more. He heard we were trying to go see the fireworks Red Rock was setting off, and Jason was very cognizant that we wanted to make it out by 9 and I really appreciated that. I have been in the restaurant industry for years and I truly appreciate how attentive and personable Jason was. He is an asset to your team, so please pass this message on for him. My friend ordered a very different kind of Caesar salad with a lot of modifications and it came out perfect. All the food tasted fresh and delicious and the garlic knots are to die for. Even the little things like sweenter wrappers were whisked away off the table before we even noticed they had disappeared. The restaurant is clean and the associates seem happy and it looks like there is a lot of teamwork and everyone helping everyone out. Thank you for an excellent meal I can still taste the garlic. I will be back ! Thank you TR!

rga-ZZt8hAqXtO8XgNmdMw.text: Been to DTS so many times and Never  been here but came in for Ladies night with friends.  Great drink selection.  Tried a pizza, meatballs and garlic knots.  They were all very good.  Wonderful atmosphere and great music.  Nice crowd.  They are stepping up the happy hour at DTS.  Will definitely be back!   Ty for a great time!

ZL4NhlKDLuvC9UByiSLeLg.text: First,we love this place,the food is phenomenal. My wife, ordered wine instead got champagne. But it was taking forever just to get water and some bread. mF--e5_Gf1fzJB0DkMdeZw.text: The 4 star rating is for the food, service was more of a mixed bag.  But, let's start with the positive.  The food was spot on and really nice for a casual, relaxed neighborhood place.  The garlic rolls are some of the best I've had in town.  For some reason, most of the garlic knots I've tried here in Vegas have not been up to par.  These are the exception.  They're soft and have that stretch and bounce of a good knot, garlicky with olive oil and a sprinkle of Parmesanm and served with extra bottles of olive oil and balsamic vinegar.  Margarita pizza with burrata was excellent, Caesar salad was tasty with dressing on the vinegary side, kids meals were decent and each meal came with a mini cannoli for dessert.  Meatballs looked great but didn't try. I would absolutely come back for the food.  Ok, here's the scoop on the service.  I think we just had an overworked server that day and that person was not at their best.  I prefer to give them the benefit of e doubt bc we all have our bad days.  Suffice it to say, service and attitude were subpar but not enough to complain to management.   In the end, we just wanted to pay our bill and move along.  The hostess and manager were very nice and courteous and greeted everyone at the door.  Conclusion:  food's great but the waitstaff could use a bit more training.  We'll be back to try again.

I_2WIhLvESmaIkLB5qUYuA.text: OK, so I am not one that reviews very often...I will make this short and sweet. YOU GOTTA TRY THIS PLACE! We had a very delicious and comfortable experience and we'll be back soon. Highly recommended!! 5 star all the way!

XzTNWPXtjXG_jQcSf58Sxg.text: This is a nice Italian restaurant in Downtown Sumerlin. I have eaten here at least 6 times since they opened. Sometimes it's just me and my wife, and other times with our (grown) kids. When it's just the two of us, we usually start with the calamari. I'm not a big fan of calamari, but at this restaurant, I make an exception. I've tried the calamari at Red Lobster, and thought I was chewing a pencil eraser. The calamari here was better than any other I have tried. I actually finished the large portion (I did have help from my wife).  If we go with the kids, we will oder the antipasto platter. Yes, it is pricey, but it's a generous size, and the quality of the meats is first rate. I'm pretty sure the prosciutto is imported from Italy.    For my main course, I seem to be stuck on the salmon. I really like their spaghetti with meat sauce, and the veal parm is awesome, but the salmon does it for me.  It is always tender, juicy, and flavorful.  It even tastes good the next day for lunch, when I can't finish it at the restaurant because I ate too much calamari or antipasto.  Oh yeah, if you have room, the carrot cake is awesome. Get three or four friends to help you finish it.    I see in a couple of reviews people were complaining about slow service. In all the times I've been here, I have not had that experience.  The staff was very friendly, and the service was professional.  Obviously if the joint was jumping, like on a Friday or Saturday night, it takes a little longer for food to arrive, but that's how it is at any busy restaurant.     Do yourself a favor, next time you have a taste for Italian food, and you're near Summerlin, check out this place.  They have indoor, and covered outdoor seating.  It's a great location to "people watch" while you are enjoying a drink and a great meal.

qPhjK7PS5MWc6Gsj12TxEQ.text: I've eaten here twice. Both times I've gotten great service and the food is delicious. They bring out complimentary garlic bread and it's so good! We ordered calamari (crispy, fresh, delicious), gnocchi with bolognese sauce (my favorite and perfectly cooked) and hubby had linguine with clam sauce (he said it was great). Great decor, ambiance and location! (next to movie theater and close to parking) Food is a bit pricey for what it is but I don't mind it being a special night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this place. Food is great! We had gnocchi and linguine with clam sauce

aB1MHuV1Lgs6T8n2qYAy9g.text: My boyfriend and I just finished a late lunch at this restaurant and let me tell you.....it is now our new favorite place!!! We were completely blown away by the atmosphere and the excellent service we received. Our servers name was Heather*** (I'm sorry heather!) and she was terrific. We also got a chance to meet the restaurant Manager, Mimmo. He is one of the main reasons we will be returning to this restaurant, besides the tasty food, of course! Mimmo is from Rome, Italy and he makes you feel like part of the family.   The atmosphere is outstanding. I absolutely love the layout of this cute little restaurant. The kitchen is open so you could see everything which is a really great touch.   They bring free garlic knots to the table, which they are so soft and accented with Parmesan and Romano cheese. We decided to start off with some calamari as our appetizer. It was the best calamari I have ever had! It was so tender and perfect. So, compliments to the chef.   For our entrees we ordered baked ravioli and baked ziti and those were excellent as well! I am completely impressed by this cute little restaurant and I will keep returning to enjoy their great food!

H9qRbR5vciAeEoMlrY-tIw.text: First off props to the awesome busser Donald! He is the only reason we had any kind of decent service. He is treated so bad by the server Ricki and it's sad to see someone work so hard for someone so rude.   We had a party of nine and from the beginning server Ricki was helping the hostess seat us. They were both annoyed and we just seemed to be an "inconvenience" to them. After we sat down Ricki was our server, and she asked what we wanted to drink. She offered alcohol we said no alcohol. She stated that she didn't ask if we wanted it. Okay well whatever than. After she bossed her busser to get drinks she took our order and we asked for bread please. She stated "once your food order goes in than you will get bread, you will have to wait". The whole time she was treating her busser like he was a slave.   She got our pizza wrong. The food was okay. Nothing to rave about.   We couldn't get her attention for anything she was to busy hanging out at the hostess stand talking and chatting. On the way out I told a manager about the experience and Ricki had the nerve to come chase us down in the walkway to the stores in downtown summerlin to tell us she didn't have an attitude and we were wrong. Talk about uncomfortable and so awful! Horrible customer service. We won't be returning! :(

kpXz7n653rN6Qw4HT6laHA.text: The original Trattoria Reggiano location inside the Venetian is pretty popular, and has had a 4 star average for as long as I can remember. So, when we first arrived to this new second location, it wasn't too shocking to hear we'd have a little bit of wait (30-45 minutes) even on a Sunday at 7pm. But it wasn't until nearly an hour and fifteen minutes later that we walked in and got seated on the patio of what might be the smallest restaurant in Downtown Summerlin.   Up until we got seated, there had only been one other party that put there name down to wait. In the time that we waited the place really started to clear out, and shortly after we got seated, there was only a handful of tables sat. The place was pretty much dead. But for whatever reason, a table of about 6 people had the whole staffs attention. They had been there the whole time we waited for a table, and were there during our whole meal. Obviously either very close friends, or family of someone associated with the restaurant. Food was coming out to them in waves, and nearly every staff member was waiting on them hand and foot. It took 20 minutes just for our waiter to come over after being sat, and throughout the meal, it didn't improve. Drinks and food took forever to come out, we had to ask for refills multiple times, and the guy seemed to barely know the menu. To put it lightly, the service sucked. Even if every waiter here was new, this restaurant has enough experience that they shouldn't have untrained staff, or even crappy service in general.   When it comes to the menu, it looks like it's pretty much exactly the same as the original location. They have a variety of classic Italian dishes, some pizza, seafood, etc. Pricing doesn't seem to be any different, and is about average for this style of Italian restaurant.   We were brought out an order of complimentary garlic knots. The flavor was actually pretty good and they had good texture, but holy friggin' grease. These things felt like they were made and then just rolled in oil. They also brought a little pepper, olive and cheese tray. It was okay, but I'm glad I didn't pay for either. Not really an impressive start.  I had pretty much already made up my mind on what I was going to order before we even came here. The filet meatballs sound good, and usually get great reviews. So, I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. The noodles were cooked well, obviously not hand made or anything, but decent. What really let me down was the meatball. I'd say mentioning filet mignon in the title is just a way to sucker you into ordering them. If there is filet mignon in them, the amount is so little it's impossible to taste. They really just taste like straight up pork meatballs with no seasoning. At $14 for an appetizer order of meatballs, and $18 for the spaghetti and meatballs, there should be no doubt that filet mignon is in them. Their supposed house made pomodoro sauce is alright, but this is far from an $18 plate.  At this point, I was done and not even thinking about trying their dessert. But most of my table wanted dessert, and oddly enough, it was the best thing about this place. Sort of. They have a "homemade" chocolate cake that looks just like the garbage Claim Jumper serves, so I passed on trying that. Their tiramisu was excellent though, and really was the saving grace of the night. I'd literally come back just for that, and would likely try the ricotta cheesecake too.  Maybe I expected too much...but with a pretty dang successful restaurant, in the Venetian of all places, I thought TR would have a lot more to offer. Long waits, horrible service, and below average food just wasn't what I had hoped for.

Paulo, our server/bartender, couldn't care less about his professionalism or even his job, for that matter. We had to ask for water twice and all he said was "oh I didn't bring them huh". We asked for the check and we waited 15 minutes because he forgot it...again. No apology.   The Venetian location is 10x better. I won't be back to this one.

dcmi4f71o0nWcO1N2dPusg.text: Decided to come here after driving all the way from Florida. Four of us sat down and placed our order, and then our waitress Hilga disappeared after that. Thirty minutes have now passed and our beers and drinks are empty but no food is present. Finally flag our server down and she looks at us and tells us yeah yeah it's coming it's on the way and she didn't even refill our drinks! Later, she comes back with a notepad and asks each of us what we ordered and began to write it down! 45 minutes in and she hadn't even given our order to the kitchen. Our server was replaced and they gave us a free antipasti platter that we didn't even want - we just wanted our food at this point. No one touched the platter at all. Our food finally came and we were approached by the manager offering us one cannoli or one slice of cheesecake for the four of us to split. One dessert for four people after sitting there for an hour waiting for our food! When the bill came, there were no apologies and no comping on any of our meals, and the food here isn't cheap at all. Hilga has been our server two times in the past and after the third time, we won't be coming back until she is gone.

The Caesar salad was good as was the lasagne. The lobster ravioli was the only thing that didn't live up to its billing. All and all it was a nice evening and if you are in the mood for Italian it is worth trying.

EqSlx0oGG4eL8vqGW2ChNQ.text: Located in downtown Summerlin..has plenty of parking. Came here for an early dinner and was very pleased. You can sit either inside or out...we sat outside because it was perfect temp out at the time. We were greeted by a friendly hostess with a smile. We were immediately seated and brought water and a complimentary plate of olives, cheese and roasted peppers. Very tasty!   After we ordered we were given the best garlic knots I ever had!! Warm, lightly salted and moist. So delicious we asked for more! Perfect to dip in the wonderful balsamic vinegar and olive oil.   We started with the arugula salad. The dressing is light and tasty. We ordered the large size and they split it for us. We really appreciate that type of service. We also ordered the ziti pasta with meatballs. The meatballs are made with filet and pork. The dish comes with 2 huge delicious meatballs. The pasta is covered in a creamy and cheesy sauce. The dish is huge and we all took some home. I recommend you split this dish..as it's very filling. The service is excellent, the food is delicious! I will be back!!

Ieeg4e7kvhIX3veBJvA7oQ.text: What a truly authentic and delicious Italian restaurant! We happened upon this place by luck - we were at Red Rock looking for a place to eat, but their fire alarm system went off and it was loud and chaotic. We couldn't wait to get out of there. Looking on Yelp, this place had great reviews and star average so we took a chance. Seeing that it was in a shopping center, we kind of did not expect a lot but what a very pleasant surprise!  We were kindly greeted and seen to a table within a few minutes. It was a little unusual to be seated side by side but it ended up working perfectly and allowed us to share plates easily and gave us a level of intimacy that is hard to achieve when sitting across a table. We were sat 45 minutes before their closing time, but there was not a hint of being rushed. They had wonderful live music on a Saturday night and we could tell there were a lot of regulars who come here just for the music.   The food! Exceptional garlic bread knots and our lovely server gave us an extra basket of them. The meatballs in the Spaghetti and meatballs were tender and delicious. My penne pasta with vodka sauce and prosciutto was perfectly sauced and al dente. The Caprese salad included heirloom tomatoes, basil leaves and the most delicate, soft fresh mozzarella.   It was not just about the delicious food and the live music, but also our wonderful Italian server who checked on us repeatedly throughout the meal and also came and chatted with us at the end. He truly made the night special.

9Neo6VEeQ7Bh2jeNUKBduA.text: Come here regularly, great staff, decent food, location and ambiance, meet our needs. We stop by for a cocktail and enjoy chatting with other patrons and staff! We have met some nice folks and many long time residents tend to hang out.

The waitress gave us a flyer for ladies night every Wednesday, ladies drink free from 6pm-8pm. If you're planning to have a nice quiet date perhaps you could come here.

mg9fq2rhS_-hSgNtdbJRWw.text: My wife and I saw Trattoria Reggiano while walking around Summerlin Downtown one day and immediately noticed what a wonderful atmosphere this restaurant has. So we decided to come back for a date night. I am glad we did! Not only is the atmosphere very romantic but the food is excellent as well. We have both been to Rome and felt like this place really captures the charm of authentic Italian restaurants. There was even live music!  As you sit down and order your drinks, they bring out amazing garlic bread and balsamic vinegar/olive oil. The bread was warm and fresh! We started our meal with the fried calamari, which was excellent! Our pasta entries were wonderful too, with rich sauces!  Attention to detail appeared to be a priority at Trattoria Reggiano, which I think is a rarity in this day and age. I absolutely recommend this place and would come again!

My family and I prefer this location compared to the Venetian Canal Shop's location.   Hilda was our server and she was a pleasure to order from!  I have ordered the white wine linguine in the past and the penne al a vodka this time around. I will say I preferred the linguine and I can't wait to order it again in the future. Granted, both dishes were DELICIOUS. The one draw back is I love angel hair pasta and it is not an option on the menu nor as a pasta substitute.  I also ordered the Morning Spritz cocktail which is an Italian staple. Trattoria always prepares it just right, with it being the perfect bitter to sweet ratio... not to mention how refreshing it is! The best summer cocktail in my opinion, so good that I wish it came in a bigger glass!   For desert I ordered the carrot cake which had beautiful layers of cream cheese frosting. It was a lovely end to my meal and I saved half of it for later!!

Our waiter was very nice and friendly  but seemed overwhelmed.  I actually had to ask for a drink refill twice as he never offered. At the end of the meal, he asked if we wanted  boxes for our leftovers, to which we agreed, then left, came back a second time and asked us again. The cherry on the cake was when a skinny, blonde hostess (who sounded also a little scattered)  inquired if I was someone's mother (who happens to be only 9 years younger than I. Clearly she did not get the memo that you never guess or assume a person's age. Not impressed and not sure I will be going back.

I ordered the caesar and cheese tortellini....I know a little boring I was feeling "classic" (don't judge! LOL). The caesar was dressing was creamy and flavorful. I think the tortellini was homemade. Not sure if it was made right there, but either way tasted very homestyle! Yes, that is a good thing!  My friend had an Arugula Salad - It was SO SO SO good! 1Ul7H5fbXpVrUcY8SrDSTg.text: Located in Downtown Summerlin next to the movie theatre, I strolled in here late last Sunday night. There's a lot of options for Italian in downtown Summerlin, but I was curious to try this place out after walking past it so many times- I'm glad I did. I tried the Chicken Parmesan and pepperoni pizza, so delicious! Their marinara had excellent flavor and they immediately give you garlic knots upon sitting down, (mouthwatering) but be careful not to get full before your food comes! Portions are on the larger side and the restaurant is nice but not elegant, perfect for just a casual date night or dinner with family. Also, friendly staff! I was one of the last tables and didn't feel rushed at all.

4KvPWbp4y2sZDOTMO6dTdg.text: Looking at some photos of food from a year ago on here, the food is nothing like that anymore. The garlic knots are pasty and undercooked, the pizza soggy, the meatballs under mixed and the spaghetti sauce way watered down, on both the pizza and spaghetti and meatballs. Very disappointing! If an Italian restaurant can't make a well-mixed juicy meatball and serve it in a fragrant thick and tasty sauce, then it fails as an Italian restaurant in my view...

I thought it was pricey at $26.  Hubs ordered penne Primavera which was also just ok.  There are way too many good Italian places in Vegas (Italian American Club, Casa di Amore,  Mastrioni) for us to go back here again!   Very busy place,  crowded and our table seemed in the way of the servers,  although we had reservations.  I wanted to like this place but I'm afraid not!

DOR3VJ0SMUB_7BkZmWdu6w.text: Another amazing meal at this fine italian restaurant. It was a birthday celebration and we had a group of 5. The server was very nice and attentive and provided great recommendations. The kale peanut salad is so amazing. The large portion is plenty for sharing. Also, the server recommened i add shrimp to the pesto gnocchi and it paired perfectly. Everyone at the table tried it and agreed it was a great choice. The pesto sauce is very good and the portion size is large. The garlic knots are to die for. The espresso drinks are made on a fine imported italian machine. Pairs perfectly with a cannoli or chocolate cake. There was great live music and the performer even sang happy brithday to our mother. The atmosphere is very inviting and everything on the menu is delicious! What more can yoh ask for?  This place is always packed for dinner when I've been. I hope they open a bigger location at some point to accomodate more patrons because the food is so darn good!

B2Mo2qgspu2gF-AXGbrtpA.text: Food - ok Service - ok Menu - ok  So, it was ok, but for the overpriced pirice, I expect a lot more.

1xqg6-epvN8VrwRdaLmSwA.text: Nice restaurant, very good service. Food was good. Pizza seems to be their best menu item. Garlic knots were very good. Baked ziti was good. Portion sizes are decent. Surprisingly, filet meatballs weren't as good as I thought they would be - caprese was presented nicely but lacking in flavor.

9qB7rGmMONbAjn18ivGjLw.text: Very good!  Went with the family as my daughter and son-in-law live in the area and live going here with the grandsons. Service was outstanding and the food was very good.    We ordered a large variety of food as well as a nice bottle of wine.  The wine prices were good as awhile with a decent selection.   I ordered the Baked Ziti with Meatballs and thought it was great.  The sauce reminded me of Vodka Sauce I've had elsewhere which I really liked.  Little cheesy and the Ziti was perfect.    Others had Kale Salad with Salmon, Risotto, Spaghetti, etc.  They also had good bread and little plates of Olives and Peppers to go with the Olive Oil and Balsamic Vinegar.    Also had live music on the Friday night we were there.    Would love to go back on our next visit.

DmDJU4BypviQJsHSBHP-Tg.text: Starting with the absolutely lack luster service, it was downhill from there. Our server could not have cared less that we were there.  We decided to split a Caesar salad, I've never seen one with tomatoes and I'm guessing the dressing was bottled.  the bread for the table was good though.  Hubs had shrimp scampi, oddest we've ever seen.  Instead of shrimp stir fried in butter and garlic, it was shrimp that had been butterflied and topped with bread crumbs and placed around the rim of a dish of pasta.  I had lobster ravioli.  What they didn't say is that it's not cold water lobster, had been frozen and was chewy and no flavor.  the sauce was so overpowering that any flavor the ravioli had was lost.  I thought it might have been my imagination but the guests seated next to us got the same thing and we all had the same impression.  We realized when we were seated that we'd been there before and hadn't loved it but thought we'd give it another try - there won't be a next time.  Amazing that most gave it four stars.  Maybe I'm just pic  Mea Culpa - I posted this is the wrong spot, should have been the one on the strip.  I apologize to the owners.  Apparently when you post to Yelp, it's there forever.

1rItEOFwgqgyDjQ7j1WeAA.text: Edit: There were 4 entree orders plus an appetizer order so not sure where you're getting your information from on only 2 entree orders. We frequent here often (7 times this year alone) and I have purchased gift cards from your establishment before, so believe me when I say, we do not take advantage of your "garlic knots" and only order the bare minimum. I do not appreciate your tone and have a feeling no gift will be coming my way. Don't say that to make yourself look good. If you had the intention, why not leave your contact information? How am I supposed to message you without your email address? My thoughts exactly.   I love there food here and come here often, but not sure if I will after what I just heard. My dad placed an order to go for my birthday and I asked him to get two dozen rolls. Now, keep in mind, these rolls are free and come unlimited when you dine in. I absolutely love these rolls and since there will be six of us eating, to ask for two dozen is not a big deal. My dad was told he can get a dozen for free but would have to charge him $12 for the second dozen. That's absolutely ridiculous to charge $1 per roll, especially for an item that should be free.

wWe5x86Br7d_g9Dww54Pbg.text: Definitely one of the better Italian restaurants in Vegas, and located in DT Summerlin.  Trattoria Reggiano is a quaint local joint that offers an assorted selection of Italian favorites and classic dishes like spaghetti and ravioli with a flair of modern touches.     Overall, the service was top notch and the food solid and tasty.  Only slight critique would be the veggies and potatoes had a bit too much virgin olive oil on them and the shrimp scampi and a bit too much garlic as well.    Enjoy the pics and would recommend a nite out with your couple friends (leave the kiddos at home) to enjoy some good food with wine and relaxing atmosphere since they also sometimes have a live performer as well in the evenings.

Y43jnYFHNsfGDq6QlGGCGw.text: We tried this place seeking some good Italian food and reading the excellent reviews. We were not disappointed!  It's located just next to Regal Cinemas in Downtown Summerlin.  Parking is plentiful and free.  They do take reservations, but we have never seen the place packed.  It's modestly sized with a bar area and patio seating as well.    We had the pleasure of being served by the bartender Bethany as the first time we came our table we adjacent to the bar, and she was so good that we asked for her specifically the other two times we came.  Attentive, friendly, and just overall excellent!  They provide complimentary garlic knots and a small plate of cheese and assorted olives.  We tried the limoncello cocktail which was excellent.  Well-crafted and strong but with a pleasant sweetness.  We also tried the Caesar salad which was excellent and quite traditional.  It does come with anchovies, but of course these can be omitted as well.  We have tried a few dishes over the three visits including spaghetti and meatballs, chicken francese, spaghetti carbonara, and the pasta Bolognese.  All were absolutely excellent.  The pasta is always perfectly al dente, and the sauces taste complex and rich.  The meatballs are hearty and taste like something right out of an Italian grandmother's kitchen.  You just cannot go wrong with their entrees.  We also tried two desserts.  The tiramisu is a "deconstructed" tiramisu served in a glass with lady finger cookies.  Interesting presentation but very good.  The chocolate cake was the only weak point in all the meals we've had hear.  Very basic and plain and unworthy of the rest of their excellent menu.  If you are in the mood for some very good Italian food with great service, then you must try Trattoria Reggiano (and ask for Bethany!).

BLK-4AmjwQEvxzSaLnV6IA.text: Loved it!! Food was great, our waitress was awesome and it was a nice vibe. We got there around 8pm and it wasn't crowded at all which was nice. They had live entertainment there, it was a guy singing and he had a pretty good voice actually. The only thing I don't suggest he do is go up to people and start singing to them while they're eating lol. It's awkward and uncomfortable, other than that a fairly nice little dinner bonus. a2FwS80hiU2uTgm4WdWHQA.text: Summerlin location experience.  I never write reviews but this was an exceptional experience for me and I wanted to share with you.   Pizza box states: "No Secrets, No Gimmicks, Simply The Finest Pizza Created With Quality, Passion and Time Honored Traditions"   This is a big joke ..... you are not going to find anything like that in this item.  Maybe the tradition is to screw you over..... not sure but that is how I felt after paying $20 for it.  Ordered margarita pizza. First try:  It was horrible. Burned outside perimeter crust. Raw center field area. Poorly assembled that was very unappealing in appearance. Burned bottom surface. Burned taste. Very little basil, 1/4 of a leaf of basil per section and very little of everything else that makes a good pizza. Rate on scale 1-10. I rate 2. I am sure you could find a worse pizza, but it would take some time to find it.  Phone call complaining to manager. Offered replacement to me.  Second try:  just as poorly done as the first try. This time even less basil leaf. Very few small pieces of cheese. Overall very poor quality especially for the price. Missing everything that makes a good pizza except for the box. The box is made of good quality cardboard.  DO NOT BUY THIS PIZZA. WASTE of your money.  If you don't believe me then go ahead and screw yourselves and buy one. Palace Station movie theater has a fantastic margarita pizza. Very yummy and about half the price.

UKOYi9w4e-raE9vdm6_w6g.text: Short story: as a kid we'd go to this place in my hometown called Joann's Italian Food with the slogan "Good food from Nina and bad attitude from Ernie"  Let me tell you, this was a promise that they always delivered.  We became accustomed to this type of Italian food sort of hole in the wall with a functioning juke box and C9 type vintage Christmas lights in the ceiling that were there all year round.  Ernie was a very dry surly older man with white beard and he loved to give us all a 'hard' time whether it was refills or needing a box.  It was his shtick and he 'shtuck' to it.  The food was amazing however.  The marinara was to die for as it was so tangy and just tantalized your taste buds and the cheese pizza was so good you'd eat the next day straight out of the fridge even if the cheese was ice cold.  Anyway, all this to say that since Joann's closed, we've been looking for something similar or at least reminiscent.  I really believed that Tratorria Reggiano delivered.  I felt like the marinara was tangy and the bolognese sauce was one of the best I've ever had even compared to trying bolognese sauces in France and Switzerland.  Everything was great!  They give you what Bethany calls 'goodies' which is their small charcuterie with peppers and olives, prosciutto/parmesan.  Garlic knot bread is great and she says it is unlimited.  Caesar salad is quite authentic and served with a sliver of anchovy.  If you go, definitely ask for Bethany, she is really sweet and kind and provides great service.  The only thing that was less amazing was the desserts.  They seemed like pretty standard Italian type desserts with a twist.  I guess because the food-food was so great, I had a higher expectation.  We have never had to wait for a table here.  The seating is all chairs and tables I didn't see a booth.  But if you go, find the hovering Vespa scooter in the ceiling (thinking its a Vespa).  We almost went to the Olive Garden nearby but after being seated next to a rowdy family where menus were thrown at my head, I felt we needed to take a chance and try something else and I'm glad we did.  It is our current absolute favorite Italian restaurant here in Vegas.

sXAp_pgYj5v7drSMSPbv8A.text: I was meeting a girlfriend for dinner here - first visit for me - and the big bonus was the discovery that we couldn't have picked a better night: on Wednesdays ladies drink for free from 6-8! Too bad I'm such a cheap date, but my one free glass of wine was nice.  We didn't have a reservation, so at first the hostess said that there would be a 45-minute wait for a table. But then said she could probably seat us before that. No lie - I was seated before my friend even arrived. The bad part was that the table was right near the bar, and a loud drunkard was using the seat part of the chairs as his personal footrest. The staff knew him to be an obnoxious idiot, and bent over backwards to move the table - twice - and side with me when I chastised the jerk.   The great service extended to the waiter, who was super. He had a name tag, but I wish I could remember what it said. He told us that his name was Irish. He had every quality that makes for a great waiter, including patience as we dallied over the menu.   After downing the fabulous garlic knots and the pepper, olive, and parmesan nibbles, we decided to share the Eggplant and Ricotta individual pizza and the Italian Kale Salad.  The individual pizza is a misnomer - it's only individual if you're a burly trucker! For us two petite ladies, half of that, plus the substantial salad, left us totally stuffed. The pizza toppings were really good, but for this ex-New Yorker, the crust could have been crisper. And a little more fresh basil would have been welcomed.  Not being a great lover of kale, I was unsure of what to expect, but it turned out to be an exceptional salad. I don't eat pancetta, so we got that, the gorgonzola cheese, and the dressing on the side. My friend gleefully had my share of the pancetta, too. But after trying the kale in combo with all the other great flavors, I think my admiration for kale has increased geometrically.  Everything is a learning experience, so here's what I learned: Yes, ladies, you can drink free on Wednesdays, but it's the most raucous night. While there's live entertainment every night (I think), it's much harder to sit across from someone and actually talk on hump night. If you want to drink and dance, this Bud's for you. As for the prices, they're a bit higher than many other restaurants, especially for main entrees, but on Mondays the pizza and pasta are half-price. But the terrific hostess (whose name I've also forgotten) and the primo service make Trattoria Reggiano a new favorite, and I look forward to going back.

haMFMklTG6MiUVybjlKqqw.text: BEWARE! They charge your credit card more than what you paid & tippefor!!! See picture attached.   I paid for a $12.08 meal on May 10, 2019. Checked my bank statement & total on my card was $52.08. Now do you think I'm actually going to tip $40 for a meal that was $12???? NOOOOO!   This waiter should be fired!  Beyond DISAPPOINTED!!!  UPDATE: I stopped by this place and spoke with the manager. He asked me to email their corporate about the incident in question and send a copy. Seriously!!?!? How and why is this my job. Isn't that the reason why he's there as a manager to resolve issues & speak to the staff that made this extra charge on my card vs making his customer do the work. Sorry, not sorry but this is not my job.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apparently I tipped $40 for a $12 meal.

crQpArdcGX_7775pU6N6sA.text: After spending a few weeks in Europe and Italy this summer, my boyfriend and I have been on an Italian kick for quite some time. I saw the reviews of this place on Yelp and decided to give it a go on Uber Eats-- only one small problem... the food was absolutely horrible.  Here's the breakdown of what we ordered and thoughts.  Lasagna: Arguably the worst lasagna we've ever eaten... ever. This lasagna is definitely not Italian. The ground filet mignon was just awful, making the lasagna very chewy and gummy and the store-bought bleached flour, thick, non-homemade lasagna noodles only contributed to this. There was a lot of grease from the fatty filet and even a hunk of gristle in the lasagna to top it off. I'm bewildered that they actually serve this and would be embarrassed if I were the chef or restauranteur. This is NOT Italian.  Lobster Ravioli: (yeah, we tried* to kick down for the good stuff). This was horrible. While writing this review I just keep shrugging my shoulders-- I just don't understand. Thick, chewy, bleached flour raviolis with puree'd seafood (that is absolutely tasteless) in a medium thick, super sweet pink sauce (Why so sweet?? Do the chefs not taste their food?) with large chunks of over-cooked chewy lobster. After about a teaspoon of salt and some fresh ground pepper this was edible. Edible... not good, but edible.   Caprese salad: This wasn't horrible, but it was a big meh. $15 got us (literally) 3 thinly sliced pieces of tomato with a very large ball of burrata (Seriously? Three slices of tomato for a huge ball of burrata? C'mon for God's sake). The caprese salad was served Italian style (legit the only thing actually Italian style) with olive oil.  Long story short, we will not be ordering from here again. I want to feel sorry for writing this review, but at a spendy cost of $86 (including delivery fees and taxes) for take out from an Italian restaurant I really just feel sorry for myself. If you're looking for good authentic Italian food-- keep looking.

It_45UPnwlFleiR9PKJ-nw.text: Staff was exemplary with food to match. We ordered the margarita pizza with buffalo cheese and were very satisfied. They offer bread at the beginning as well. Definitely recommend.   Food 5/5  Restaurant was very attractive with nice views of DT Summerlin. Windows are able to open and retract completely in order to allow the restaurant to open up more. Lots of seating. Clean along with clean restrooms.   Restaurant 5/5

Fwu2zhGH2aBiG5dUxt-9ZQ.text: A decent option for Italian food if you find yourself in Downtown Summerlin. They have a large patio for outdoor dining on nice days.  The garlic knots to start were very good. I liked the oil and vinegar for dipping with the garlic knots as well. We shared a Caesar Salad to start that was good and came with the traditional anchovies on top.   My Eggplant Parmesan Sandwich was good. This eggplant had the perfect thickness for a sub with a nice tasting marina. Crusty bread and mozzarella topped it off. My husband enjoyed his Sausage Pizza.   Overall, a decent meal, but not overly memorable. I'll keep this spot in mind for the patio dining though.

cElAb4sj_W8-FMQjmcbdzg.text: Have not been here for some time so it's time for an update. Had reservations for 5 PM and were seated promptly upon arrival. We selected a table on the indoor patio which had plenty of light from the large windows. Our server Jason was friendly. The service was prompt and attentive. Jason was very familiar with the menu and checked on our satisfaction during dinner. He also encouraged to relax and linger after dinner to enjoy the live music which started at 6 PM   We started with complementary dinner rolls that were warm and savory. Go easy or you will fill up before the main event. Next the Baked Clams appetizer (8 clams) which were delicious but a few were over toasted. A lemon squeeze was the perfect topping.  Chicken Marsala was juicy with an abundance of mushrooms along with a tasty sauce. Chicken Francese breast was tender and had the right balance of lemon and butter. Both entrees was large portions with plenty to take home. The selection of desserts that were brought to the table looked decadent but we had to pass with no room left to enjoy.

LiblJ-Lxqfz4Xdp8zb1ybw.text: Just strolled in here randomly looking for something to eat before watching a movie at Regal next door. First impression was that the restaurant itself is really beautiful. Open kitchen and bunch of open doors leading inside from the patio seating.  Minno was our server and he was super italian and very friendly. I mean like super Mario level italian. Like thats a spicy meat a ball level italian.   My mother and I had the Calamari, caesar salad, and the Margerita with proscuitto pizza (cant remember exact name).  The complimentary garlic bread was delicious with the olive oil and balsamic vinegar.  The calamari was honestly the best I think Ive ever had. Definitely using really fresh squid. Batter was light and crispy and most importantly the meat was still perfectly cooked and tender and the Marinara dipping sauce was amazing. I literally cleaned the whole plate.  Caesar salad was really good too, they are using high quality ingredients here and it makes a world of difference. Beware of the anchovy garnish though because it was intensely salty, do not eat in one bite like I did.  The pizza was honestly the most unimpressive part, I dont know if it was because I was so damn full already which definitely affects how tasty something is, but I just wasnt blown away. Still not bad by any means. Granted I did eat two garlic knots, half a caesar salad, and 75% of the calamari before even tasting the pizza though..  I want to try the pasta dishes next time because they look amazing, and this place is definitely on the more authentic side so Im sure they taste legit too.  If youre at this mall, eat here.

g8YLtC4_HUMCFm3PoX1ffQ.text: Hilda our server was on point and knowable of the wine list. Spaghetti with meatballs was perfectly hot. Red sauce was just about perfect and not a mushroom in site,bits of garlic and see through onions. The wine was Bon Anno, Nappa Valley price at $50.00 a bottle. Antipasto, roasted and marinated red, yellow bell peppers,olives green,red and black and perfect hard cheese. The bread was a type of hard roll pretzel type. It did lack butter in the baking process. The double dark chocalate cake was perfect not overly sweet. Coffee was average but doable. I would have gave a 5 stars but the rolls bread gave it a 4.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T90iBjvH2pfJ3XpPCuYQ_w.text: Best food and staff in town hands down!  I am gluten free and they accommodated everything amazingly and made me feel so comfortable.  The bartender Bethany took time to make sure she had everything right and was so helpful and an absolute pleasure to be around. The GM Wendy and the manager Daniel were accessible to everyone in the restaurant and were so courteous, they immediately make you feel like you are part of a big Italian family, which I actually am! First time here but 100% not the last. Thank you so much for an amazing experience.

eE1vB0nULAzEFgMrsG7IgQ.text: Table for 3  The pro: -Service   The con: -Lobster Ravioli  *Lackluster on the sauce when it came to flavor and depth.  *Pasta was still doughy  -Gnocchi al Pesto *Lackluster on the flavor of the sauce as well, however beautiful color and consistency that is pesto.  -Seafood Linguini *Oddly there was a pool of sauce or pasta water, I don't recall, but wasn't at all pleasing to see.   Not the best or worst Italian food, it was just okay. The food lacked a lot of the hearty flavor profiles that is Italian.

dlDNu2tJ5wcPNhZByzto1g.text: I went during the lunchtime hour with a co-worker. The food and service were great. The staff members were friendly and attentive. A good spot for a date night with the wife.

4jnBz18aBUB2364Nlpz4Dw.text: We love this place. Everything from service, food, drinks and  atmosphere is excellent. I don't love everything on the menu but we LOVE the meatballs, soups, several pasta dishes, caprese salad and the pizza is excellent!! Tiramisu is fresh, homemade and unlike all other restaurants. The indoor/outdoor restaurant always feels cozy. We love the patio but when it's chilly we like inside just as much. Saturday night with live music is fun and relaxing for date night. We've even run into a few famous folks here while enjoying the live, old school (rat pack type) of music. Great for people watching too:)  We've been many times, and I failed to write a review sooner. However, after visiting another Italian place also in DTS that left us regretting our need to try something new,  I felt compelled to write this review before I forget again.

XApNUWgTBfLyTzori-IwbQ.text: Really great food. Taste, presentation. Table of five, everyone enjoyed their meals. This was a four star experience, but Mimmo, our server made eating here a five star night!

KnAG3aV9hD5GxkWwd77IhQ.text: Been here before and had a good experience with one of the friendly bartenders. I guess that was our only lucky day here. Things went downhill fast this visit. This time was completely awful. It ruined my daughters birthday dinner! Very disappointed in how they OVER CHARGE for dietary restrictions or substitutions. Since when does it make sense to sub out prosciutto for broccoli florets for $5 charge? Well it was $5, and There were maybe 6 broccoli florets in the entire dish. Felt like I was being nickled and dimed. Had I known that they were importing the broccoli from Mars or blessed in holy water, I could've went to Trader Joe's across the way and brought my own to save money. Anyways, We ordered the gluten free version of penne ala vodka. This item comes with prosciutto. The server informed me I would not even be receiving anything close to the menu item that was already priced at $30. No vodka no prosciutto no pink sauce. So what was it that we were receiving? Still have no idea to this day. The server had such an attitude problem about everything from the start, we should've known it wasn't going to be a pleasant experience. We also put an order in for a Cesar salad as a starter no croutons. I asked if we could add onions to the salad. Insert eye roll from server here. She finished taking our order and walked away. Our salad arrived with our pasta, 30 mins later! The server made sure to bob and weave away from us as to not answer any of our questions. She did not want to come up with an explanation as to why it took 30 mins for a starter salad to arrive! The really nice busser was kind of enough to refill our waters and provide my 5 year old daughter with bread. My husband and I had our food come out before my daughters basic spaghetti with marina! Everyone knows you serve the kids food first before the adults, especially when it's simple pasta with marina already cooked in the back. Alas, our server was unaware of such hospitality. We flagged her down asking where our daughters food was, she said oh lemme check and never came back. The friendly busser came to the rescue with my daughters food. We finished our meal and asked for the check. We were shocked to see a $6 charge for gluten free pasta and a $5 charge for broccoli. We asked the server why so expensive if it's technically not penne ala vodka and substitute broccoli. She said that was policy. Wooooow. We then noticed a charge for $3. We asked what was this about? She said it was for the onions in the salad?!?!?! So you're telling me it was $4 to put 6 onion slices in a small cedar? Was it farmed to table in that very instance? In what universe is this acceptable? I've managed some high end restaurants and been bar manager at others, none of these "standards" would've been acceptable. Broccoli is nowhere near the price of prosciutto. Why would you charge someone for vodka sauce if they're not getting vodka sauce? She might as well charged me for a steak and said well it's the same thing. To round off the crap night, I had to ask the server 3 times if she could sing happy birthday to my daughter. She brought a cannoli with no candle or anything. She was too busy to even acknowledge my kid or smile at the very least. She set the plate before her and did not even try to light the candle. She just walked off! Two tables down it was someone else's birthday and what do you know? They had a wonderful server who got the whole restaurant to sing a joyous happy birthday to them and with a smile! Must've been a nice feeling. Explain to me why she's in the hospitality business again? Thanks for a horrible memory on a special day. Do not waste your time or money at this place unless you're a masochist and love flushing money down the drain. Go to the other Italian places in downtown summerlin or wolf gang puck. They always treat you with respect and never charge you extra.

sRZR9RxlpWTFkpuQUl4jlg.text: This restaurant has great food, great service and great ambiance. I love the garlic knots instead of bread. Our server was nice and funny. I love the open kitchen and the classy decor throughout the restaurant. My food was delicious. The chocolate cake is AMAZING!

yTnkhvKZP9Prq264i1KXfA.text: Worst service- be prepared to lose your appetite from the frustration!  Asked on three separate occasions to three separate folks for oil and vinegar- got it on fourth try .  Manager offered to comp the bill- I refused !  This high potential restaurant need serious training/corporate attention- it's on a rough start- sorry!

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vespa hanging between crystal chandeliers? Weird? Maybe!

AaKJTJ4V7I9s-I8l7xWZWg.text: This restaurant just opened today! Service was excellent!! My wife is pregnant and not able to have bleu cheese. The item she ordered had some crumbled on top. Ben took ownership and insisted on remaking the dish without it. After my wife was cool enough to say she would just pick it off, Ben insisted and had the dish remade. Wonderful staff, great food, and most importantly to me great service. We highly recommend this new spot at DT Summerlin, we will for sure be coming back!

B_Fwhms8DwQBknfQa7zNCA.text: This place is amazing from the garlic knots to the atmosphere.  Their bruschetta pizza is out of this world.

qv0tdnvRw3VBolQT9A39GQ.text: Eli is the best bartender in Summerlin. Creative, inventive, and gracious.  Have him create a berry grappa martini or a chocolate espresso martini for a sumptuous beginning and end. Going back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SBj4axKgZgSJoyXJw-zhug.text: No wait on a Sunday afternoon.  Expect to wait if you go on Friday or Saturday night (I tried once before and was told 1 hour wait .... no thanks).  Great selection of Italian dishes.  I had the lobster ravioli and wife had the linguini and claims.  Both were very good.   The flavors were very authentic. Lots of claims.  Also had the espresso martini that was well prepared (not too strong on the alcohol and a good espresso flavor)  Another big thing with this restaurant are the complementary garlic knots.  They are great.  They have olive oil and vinegar on the table, but some butter might also be nice.  Also, when we got our first batch, they were very cold and I mentioned this to the waitress who said "Ohh, they just came out.  So do you want a new one?"  Yeah, right -- they just came out (15 minutes ago).  Nice try.  The correct response is -- "I'm sorry, I'll get you a fresh batch right away."  But they were replaced with a hot fresh batch about 3 minutes later.  In fact, if I had any complaint, I would say that our server was not the most attentive (took a while to bring drinks, took a while to bring the bread, the aforementioned breach comment).  The other complaint was the prices -- almost $70 for lunch for two with no dessert and one martini drink (including tip).  A bit pricey, but this is appears to be the new norm in the bourgeois downtown Summerlin area, so I guess its to be expected.    The dessert tray looked good (and I would like to try the TIramisu) but I was full so will have to be next time.  Anyway, I will definitely go back and try out some other things.

0BSEA6-LtiKSbEbKMMXZdA.text: Place is beautiful, no doubt. $16.00 for the Kale Chicken Salad is too pricey for lunch. The pizza looked great but I have to say the tomato sauce was very bland and had no flavor. I had to salt the pizza.

NG0t8kaycq-uWFNcB-hBNg.text: We have been here three times and all three times I have been very disappointed.  The service is great but the seafood dishes have been very disappointing!  The first time I ordered linguini and clams. at least six clams didn't open and the sauce was bland and flavorless and the clams had a very fishy taste and smell.  They did give me additional clams but half of them had broken shells that led me to believe they took the ones that didn't open and just broke the shells to get the clams out. I didn't eat them because if a clam shell doesn't open on its own it is because the clam is already dead and who knows how long it has been dead.  Second time there I had the shrimp scampi. The shrimp were not over cooked but they were stuffed!?  The breading they were stuffed with were soaking in oil.  There was no delightful garlic/wine sauce it was just butter and stuffing.  So I removed the stuffing and ate the six or seven shrimp.  The third time I ordered the shrimp and linguini in their red sauce.  The shrimp tasted very fishy again and the red sauce was utterly bland! It was extremely disappointing.    My husband had their veal parmesan and said it was good except that the veal wasn't pounded down and the thickness was a little off-putting and a too thick breading covered the veal.  He also had, on another visit, their carbonara and he liked it a lot and on our third visit he had the baked ziti and thought it was very good but the meatballs were  horrible.  Our friend had the lobster ravioli in a pink sauce.  The pink sauce had a very mild flavor and he said it was okay.  The garlic knot bread is good and the service is good.  The manager or owners ask you how everything is and we always say it's good but I just don't like to make negative remarks in front of their customers so this review is more for them and I just pray the read it.    We love everything about the restaurant but the seafood dishes need a major overhaul and they need to remake their meatball recipe.

JO2mut0wSlChNjvGbtJoHw.text: Great Veal Parm and Eggplant! Service was fantastic ! Only thing I don't like is the seating is a little too close together , otherwise it was delicious real Italian food!

eJ-d2ytfrbnOPMo9aUuHAQ.text: The service was top notch. No complaints there - our drinks were always filled and my brother took his last sip of his beer just as the waiter asked if he'd like another. Really on top of things. However... The prices they charge for their food is a little ridiculous. I got the chicken parm and while it was good it was just your regular chicken parm, not worth the $26. The salmon my mom got was dry and flavorless. The pesto gnocchi my sister got was super bland. The pizza my brother got was good but didn't really have much to it in terms of flavor. The entire meal was definitely over priced. They had an Italian band playing too. And his voice was nice, but it was really too loud. We can barely talk to each other without screaming. It kinda threw it all off. Maybe it would be a better ambience for a one on one date? But not for a family. We won't be back, unfortunately.

5jr8pBIOpA6k3wvd9_-3Tw.text: This is the real deal! We started with the Calamari and the Caprese Mozzarella. The calamari perfectly cook and the Mozzarella creamy and delicious.  I had the linguini with clams. The pasta perfectly cooked and the little neck clams overflowing!  My husband had the eggplant and pasta that was to die for!  Then on the to dessert!  We shared a piece of ricotta cheese cake that was smooth and tasty. One of the best I have had in a long time. We also had the cannoli that had great filling and a nice crunchy shell. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. It is definitely a place we will be coming back to time and time again!

U1tNuZkprizHW_f8NMkTBQ.text: My first time here, food was delicious! I recommend this place, if you want real Italian food. Love it...

iDM8WtmbQVYNzQwzAFuMwA.text: What a fantastic experience, both food and service were superb!! The home made meatballs are phenomenal!! We will be back soon!!

2fz_jRnfIZPcQ7D5E0NGFg.text: The worst, over priced, and the kind of service that belongs at a truck stop. Was man handled by a waiter with a attitude like he just caught his wife in bed with his brother. Ordered baked clams that were thrown on the table as was the rest of the dishes like a set of dice and tasted like oiled bread. The shrimp scampi was so salty I drank a gallon of water over a two hour period. The shrimp was hard, rubbery, and chewy. Dropped a $100 bill on that miserable experience. BEWARE !!!

QxI3Ds6ccVf62JPSjMDM2w.text: We ate here yesterday and was presently surprised at how good it was.  We ordered the bucatini carbonara, linguine with clams and the eggplant parmesan and all were excellent and large portions.  The garlic bread was great but I would just prefer the choice of just plain old  Italian bread.  The balsamic vinegar and olive oil was good but I asked for butter which was brought quickly. Our server Zeki was professional, attentive and polite.  We were also given a dish of olives, red peppers and hard parmesan cheese to our delight.  We will try it again soon.

4HurWSmFKsuyL4Oy-8XYcw.text: We went on a busy night during the holiday season but were able to make a reservation for two anyway. They were nice about accommodating. I thought the food here was surprisingly good. I had shrimp scampi and my husband had swordfish. Both were very flavorful and nicely prepared. The service was very good albeit a bit slow (not over the top great, but still good). The ambiance is just okay....we were seated inside and it's very cramped (indoor dining area is really small). Overall, a tasty meal. I would go back again for the food.

3YrBpsQNUwsO1n-vJEb7Fg.text: We had a great meal last week.  Vegetables were cooked perfectly and the waiter, an older gentleman, was great with the kids.  Everyone's meal came out on time and was nice and hot.  Prices were fair.  We will be back again.

-OC9H166GUzV8neLhTo3zg.text: Food was great!  First time here...quick bite in between showing homes today...Joli and I split a chicken parm sandwich...perfect for 2.  Our server Ricki was great!  Thank you!

NXmbRIJHRtvZatBv7OaECA.text: So, I'm not Italian but lived in Rome, Italy from the end of second grade through High School and have returned to visit many times. It is one place I call home. Coming to Tratorria Regiano reminded me a bit of what I come to expect when revisiting Italy. Good food and excellent service are both on display here. Our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and specials, which was very nice indeed, but I was more focused on the native Italian busboy who cleared the table and supplied the Reggiano to my party's salads and pasts dished. The man couldn't have been much younger than 70 years old and he was totally committed to making sure our table was always well-attended to. I forgot the man's name but I want him to know that I give the restaurant the extra star for his exceptional service. I had the ravioli and it was made al dente just as it would have been made back home, in Roma. The salad was huge and my friend's plates were delectable looking as well. Buona fortuna, Tratorria Reggiano e ci vediamo subito!

uTr5BmVB5suYRKF5HPLCjg.text: The wait was a little bit long. So we sat at the bar for a couple drinks. It was all just okay. After we finally got seated we decided to have the Meatballs! They were delicious, probably the best part of the experience. My boyfriend got the truffle Alfredo and it was 44$. I had a bite and it definitely was not worth the 44$. I would not come back here for anything in particular. The experience was just okay.

BAooKM5vvUDjXjxNT8XJtw.text: My boyfriend and I have been there twice and each time the experience has been nothing less than amazing. The food was delicious, especially the garlic knots, and the service with Eli was even better. The only downfall is that I wish it was closer to our home so we could go more often. Thank you guys for the great food and service! You will definitely be seeing much more of us.

WmnrmgqzRLl3tXMO6wfukQ.text: The best gluten free pizza in town. You can sit outside on the patio, sometimes they have live music  the servers especially Britt knows her craft!!! Bravo

u2zOlnuxhxmrJaVgYBtOaQ.text: I'm a creature of habit. So when it's winter time in Vegas,  the intense craving of warmth draws me here biweekly until the ice thaws. My go-to order is meatballs, garlic knots, broccoli rabe, and pasta e fagioli. I'm pretty sure everything on the menu is good, but I can't risk ordering my go-to items. You have all your food group to feel good about your meal especially after good workout session. The atmosphere is beautiful with just the right amount of class but not stuffy. I picked up a togo order on a Thursday night once and it was bustling with life music. In Vegas, there's no shortage of Italian food, but this place has the right amount seasoning in all categories.

TK4pxBWnv4oa0GAsNbErPA.text: Our server Zeki was GREAT! We shared the eggplant, caprese and filet mignon meatball appetizers for our meal. It was not only delicious but also filling and we had enough leftovers to take home for another meal.   The outdoorsy atmosphere was beautiful, but there was only ONE bathroom for the whole restaurant and it was unisex. That seemed a little crazy to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers!

z1C4g0VnjWPv_JkAK6ODPQ.text: VISUAL AESTHETIC: 3/5 Trattoria Reggiano is located within Downtown Summerlin, right beside the Regal Cinemas. The sign is properly displayed and easy to find, while the parking lot is also convenient and just steps away from the restaurant itself.   This can be positive or negative, depending on the party dining, but the restaurant is coddled between the theatre and an adjacent restaurant while across the way is a set of buildings. Although this is the layout of the shopping center, the wall creates a short of "block" in the space for the outdoor patio seating.   The seating arrangement outdoors and indoors is quite small, and the bar has a wall that slices through it which divides the visible advantage of space. Tables are covered with a paper and have a cup of Crayons which offers a "family friendly" aspect for those that have children.   Overall, the atmosphere is average. The dining decor is comfortable, and the level of noise is also average.  FOOD: 1/5 It was my first time dining here. The reviews drew my mom and I to this restaurant and we decided to celebrate my birthday here. We wanted to take our time ordering as we expected to eat and drink for a prolonged period.   We ordered two martinis, which were fine, and we also picked two starters, the mussels and calamari. Just a clarification, the serving sizes were HUGE; our server DID NOT mention anything at all when we were ordering so we ended up full with the two appetizers alone.  We were given garlic knots and a plate of antipasto which contained cheese, olives, and cooked peppers. This was perhaps the best part of the meal because the mussels were not fresh. They were soggy and the meat lacked any texture other than "mush". The calamari was alright, but room temperature when we received it -- Which was 40 minutes after we ordered. The sauces for both of the dishes were nothing special, though we ordered the "spicy" sauce for the calamari which had no spice whatsoever and looked like it  came out of a can.  SERVICE: 1/5 The service here was awful, which is an understatement. Upon arrival, the hostess was extremely slow and chatty with the party before us. I understand customer service and catering to patrons, but there were people in line behind us. You cannot take fifteen minutes to seat one party and hang out to talk to them at their table when others are also waiting. This was unprofessional.  After we were finally seated, we didn't get to have a waitress until we had read over the entire food, drink, and wine menu several times. When she finally did show up, she made it obvious that she did not want to spend time at our table because we watched as she catered to every table around ours from getting drinks, refilling bread, to serving the actual entrees.   And this is picky of me, but every time I have ever been ID'd on my birthday, I am typically told "Happy Birthday"? I believe this is a typical service at most restaurants, but I suppose she didn't bother to actually look at my ID when she had asked for it, glancing and handing it back to me immediately.  We had stated that this was our first time at Trattoria Reggiano's and our server made no effort to tell us about the serving size of their portions. But had the audacity to come back later to ask if we wanted entrees. When we declined, she proceeded to say that she didn't think we would since she "wanted us to see the amount of food for ourselves". I was completely appalled at that sort of answer.  OVERALL EXPERIENCE: 1/5 I have dined at other restaurants within Downtown Summerlin and this has to be one of the worst experiences I have had. The food was mediocre, the service was less than sub par, and this place really doesn't deserve the raving reviews that are going around online. I am completely disappointed and will not be returning to such an unprofessional restaurant.

19SDtmUtJ6kjZIuoDW7TBg.text: Just one meal here and I am now a super fan!  I already can't wait for my next trip to Vegas!!! I just want to eat here.    If I knew I was to die tomorrow, my last meal would be their pizza and garlic bread!  My husband, who is very finicky, LOVED his pasta!   Lastly, the service is impeccable!  It's the Nordstrom of restaurants, they want to make you happy and take great care to give you nothing less than amazing service!   The ambiance is great and it doesn't make you feel like you're in Las Vegas.

k8qozcvcHD20x2IXoc5OXw.text: Usuallly love this place but when you're #glutenfree and you order gluten-free food, even asking them to double check, send it back because it's not gluten free, get another one, eat it and then find out it wasn't gluten free #gonnabesick #glutenfreefail

WYWW4bONluFNcYFrfb7QWw.text: We love to eat at this place.  The food is so delicious.  I had the salmon which is always on point.  The service was wonderful.  We had Sandy as the person supporting our waiter Justin.  Both were wonderful.  Sandy was exceptional.  It was almost like she was standing by waiting to take care of our needs before we even knew we had them.  She was never imposing and was pretty stealth at refilling our drinks.  Thank you for not only a nice meal but excellent service.  We will keep going back!

AO5_4GngnKVURyHI_gApAg.text: The food was great, and the atmosphere is lovely. Most restaurants of this caliber neglect the vegetables not this place they were cooked perfectly. Unfortunately I couldn't give it five stars cause the restaurant is located across from Dave & busters .

bbZcr_5fIK2bjgyOX8OvyQ.text: I am so very happy we went in to this AMAZING place today with my son for lunch! Very pleasant atmosphere, quite, clean, excellent service and attitude. We got all attention, everything was served just right on time, simply delicious! Pizza is just not comparable with retailer's or other restaurants, hand made, thin crust, smells and looks so yammy. Thank you, the owner and our server. We will be back to this little Italy!

Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K1oyh0xXA0uoyXSFSf8dnA.text: Came here yesterday for a nice lunch date with my love, it was good. We sat outside on the patio and being the oven that we are it was surprisingly cool. They have fans and air conditioning I believe ( I felt cold air coming no out of the vents) Any-who. We brought our dog with us and was also surprised that they are dog friendly although the hostess/waitress didn't offer water for her. My SO ordered the pizza margarita and I the meatball sub with fries. The pizza was okay could've been cooked longer at the bottom and the crust was a bit chewy for our liking as well but the rest was like I said okay. The meatball sub however was on point . Crusty bread, tender meatballs in a well seasoned sauce, delicious melty cheese and the crispest fries I've had in a long time. The waitress was very nice. I highly recommend.

o8wWf8TA-2TCp7j9A7diqg.text: This restaurant was soo good. Just randomly stopped in and it was Amazing! My sister and I got salmon and arugula salad (best salad I have ever had) and Shrimp scampi and we shared both. The linguine and sauce were so good. The sauce was light so it did not feel heavy like an Alfredo sauce. The shrimp was not cooked that well and that's the only reason I did not give it 5 stars. It was super crowded but the service was still great. Never had an empty drink which is a big plus. My daughter had spaghetti and she could not e happier.
