9uLnfOOyMJ7p-aeaOrjz7g.text: Amazing place for lunch service, a good wine selection to compliment most meals. It did take a while to get food but everything seemed like it was made when ordered, with quality ingredients. The portions are very generous, as they should be to meet the higher than average prices.

_b_cKTMLC-xnwJW3pCR56Q.text: My husband and I dined here on Saturday night. We were visiting from out of town and staying at a nearby resort. We wanted Italian, but wanted to get out of the hotel. This place was close and had some good reviews. We are so glad that we decided to eat here!!  Our server was fantastic. The receipt said "Dominico" but I forgot to look at his name tag. Anyway, he was an older gentleman with an accent. He made great recommendations and steered us exactly where we wanted to go. We ended up ordering the Italian Kale salad to start and let me tell you....it was amazing! Then we got the Lobster Ravioli for our main course and it was fantastic as well. We were both very impressed. There was also live music and it was perfect.  We only make it to Vegas about 2 times/year and I can't wait to come back to enjoy another meal here. Next time we will make sure to save room for a cannoli!

nAEhuha3i3AQqQCckdlG8Q.text: Yelp found us a wonderful place for Father's Day dinner as we began a two week road trip. Service was EXCEPTIONAL! Hilda was sweet and attentive as were the bussers. She even brought a small cannoli to my husband for dessert.  Food was great! You start with a little appetizer dish of peppers, olives and parm cheese chunks along with the best garlic knots ever. Could have stopped there. So good! And Hilda brought MORE!! Swordfish Siciliana was delicious - tender, juicy approx 8oz piece was plenty to share with capers, olives and tomatoes. We shared it along with the eggplant pizza which had a crispy thin crust and sliced eggplant and riccota. Lovely. Kid had what looked to be house made tortellini. Can't tell you much more than they disappeared quickly.   Wonderful experience in Vegas, away from the drama of the strip.

chFxW5IHzBBmv7ExmSG9fg.text: Great atmosphere here. We sat outside, they had warmers so it was perfect. They had a guy on a keyboard and another singing, they were awesome. Our server was great. I ordered a cheeseless pizza and she asked if there's was an allergy they needed to know about, which I thought was awesome that she asked. My friend ordered a pasta dish that looked and smelled amazing, but my pizza was awful. Usually when you order something with capers, they're just kinda sprinkled on, but this was like an entire jar of capers had been dumped on the pizza. That was the only thing you tasted. The crust had no flavor, the mushrooms had no flavor, the sauce was barely visible.  The crust was hard and flat, it was like a cracker. I couldn't cut it with a knife, and it was difficult to pick up to eat. But both the pizza and the pasta dish were huge portions and everyone was super friendly so I would recommend this place, just not the pizza.

N4Xhsygm2BTGs8b6YKlJ5Q.text: The Most Amazing Dining experience we have ever had, not only was then food Amazing but the service was second to none Mimmo went above and beyond ! I can't express how amazing our service was! They have definitely earned lifetime customers with us! This is now our favorite place in Las Vegas!!!!!!! Thank you!!!'

aw1MSAk_xKhplZId5dptXQ.text: First the positives: The cannolis are very good, and are similar to what you would find in New York Italian Pastry shops. Unlike many cannolis that are served in Vegas (in which the cream filling tastes like flavored whipped cream), Reggiano makes a decent authentic cannoli cream filling, made with ricotta cheese (which makes the filling thicker and tastier). The Pasta e Fagioli Soup is also very good. The service was fast and friendly, and the atmosphere/decor was casually pleasant. Now for the negatives: I ordered the baked ziti with meatballs. The meatballs were decent size, and made with high quality meat, however they were very bland (I did not taste any garlic, onion, or any other ingredients usually found in meatballs....I don't think they even added salt). The baked ziti was OK, but again, a little bland, because it was just pasta and cheese (they should have added meat, like ground beef and/or ground sausage, that is typical for this dish). Also, they serve their baked ziti in a Pomodoro sauce (baked ziti should really be prepared in a meat sauce to give it more flavor). Overall, this place is OK, but there are so many other great restaurants to choose from in Vegas, that I would not go back to Reggiano for dinner. However, I would definitely go back for just some cannolis.

Zwh7ynU44EES-aULby19VA.text: Great food and excellent service! Also, the patio is a really nice spot to relax and have a drink!

LzItc8rk772UyelqQdgVQg.text: New favorite place at DT Summerlin request Paolo he treated us like we were the most important people in the room and he's Italian from Milano. Gives the place a REAL vibe.  Felt like we were sitting in Italy.   Great place to go right before seeing a movie, it's literally right next door to Regal DT Summerlin.   They have a Happy hour too which is nice and the outdoor seating is really comfortable a real plus is you can hear yourself talk. Unlike some of the other restaurants in DT it's a great place to connect and meet with friends, we loved it! Service by Paolo was superb, I know I said it again but it's worth repeating. Great calamari, Chicken Parm is one of the dishes they're known for. We had such fun and loved it. See Vito the manager and ask for Paolo you won't be disappointed...

AXEpSAEKEdTGiHAIqtkjfg.text: Love this place! My favorite restaurant for the past year as I am very picky about my pasta but every pasta dish here is to die for! Best waiter is Mimmo, he's wonderful and sweet and attentive. Everyone I bring loves it. And the live music is very enjoyable. Especially sitting outside just enhances the experience, beautiful restaurant and mall to shop at after!

Gr2UopMzZdV3V03KAsN8RQ.text: In the mood for Italian food before seeing a show. We decided to try Trattoria Reggiano in Downtown Summerlin. The ambience he's quite nice. You can choose between eating Outdoors on the patio or inside. Both good options. The service was excellent. The complimentary garlic knots  that they serve  at the beginning of the meal  a truly outstanding . Unfortunately the rest of the food did not rise to that level. For my entree I chose the chicken marsala. It comes with a side of pasta. The chicken was chewy and the flavor blah. My wife went with the meatball baked ziti. Also very mediocre. My buddy order the lasagna. He had difficulty eating it and rated it as poor at best. I gave it three stars rather than less because of the garlic knots and the outstanding service period but I certainly would not return here when there were so many other options for good quality Italian food in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala. Blah at best.
Photo of Trattoria Reggiano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A split arugula salad.

NEq3Boq7KoGZmUIWN8mgGQ.text: Tried this place for the first time last night and I liked it. We were seated outside so it was a little chilly, but at least they had the heaters to make up for it. Their garlic bread is delicious and is a great way to start your meal. I had the chicken francese and really enjoyed it. The chicken was cooked right and it was tender and juicy, while the pasta was alright. It's pretty awesome that they have a live performer as well when I went. I can see this place as a great place to go for a date night.

_osProcrLtMC35rXU_SmGg.text: Had to drop off a present for a birthday dinner that I could not attend.  They did hold it for me and said they would keep an eye on it but did not want full responsibility for it.  Which was very understandable.  The manager which I think her name was Karen was super sweet and they did hand it to the birthday girl.  Thank you for your great customer service!

2SjDJtJyYQbVlxjrTDNXHg.text: The service was amazing here. We came here during their lunch time on a Sunday. They had a brunch menu, which was basically similar to their dinner menu but in a smaller portion. However, this portion was definitely not small at all. It just seemed like they served dinner portion food in a small plate. We ordered couple beers, and they were served in a cold icy glass, which we loved for a sunny Sunday afternoon. Also, we ordered their carbonara pasta with shrimp and Vongole. The linguine was cooked perfect, and so was the spaghetti. I love their shrimp for some reason, since they cook it so tender.   Our server-I believe his name was Anthony- was friendly, attentive and caring. We found a random piece of thick thread in our vongole, but didn't really care. It was not a hair or anything. We killed the dish, and at the end of the meal, we told the server that the food was amazing-however, we still went ahead and told them about the little piece that we found so they could prevent it from happening to other customers-since some people do rage about nothing.  The manager came over to our table and apologized. I do not think it was their fault, since things like this can happen. He comped the pasta dish for us, which made us feel horrible. However, we left the amount as tip, and left very satisfied.  TIP! The Andes Mint Chocolates they give at the end of your meal are perfect dessert!  Love every aspect of this restaurant. I specially like this location better than venetian one. Definitely give it a try!

ZkGyw7v5BWwlJbHrjSWePA.text: Went for the first time. Had a really good experience dinning here with my girlfriend. Very attentive waiter and the food was great. Highly recommended!

DZQ9U2aZOb_cmD1KbEF_4A.text: Trattoria Reggiano is my new favorite Italian restaurant.   BEST SHRIMP SCAMPI EVER! They coated the shrimp with bread crumbs. The sauce was not greasy at all because it had a hint of fresh lemon juice. I devoured it!   The meatballs were very juicy and the meat sauce was great. The meatballs are actually a mix of filet minion and pork.   The spaghetti and meat sauce was great as usual. The noodles were cooked perfectly and the sauce complimented it very well.   The atmosphere was great and I loved the live music during dinner time. The service was very good and our server made sure to ask us and the tables around how the food was. He also made sure to keep our water filled which I know is something minor but it shows they are paying attention to our table.

7PN6OYFn6nIyU0kVhT-HDg.text: BETTER THAN EVER! I think I ate there 20 times this year!  Bethany and the entire crew (including managers) make the experience fantastic! FIND BETHANY!!!!

H_GMRCnXC2k8FqEsQ4UnAw.text: Come for the Garlic knots and complimentary antipasto plate...they are the best things offered here. The location is great (next to movie theatre) and I can see why it would be a goto spot in Downtown Summerlin. The patio seating with live lounge music is a nice place to hang out during the weekend...make sure to place reservations. The singer will politely ask for your favorite songs but then play her own lol...it's her thing :) A bottle of wine and great service from Sam and Daniel, the manager, plus the Garlic knots make this place worth revisiting. The food is lackluster and overpriced but TR's crowd doesn't seem to mind.  Chicken Marsala, Veal Piccata  - Both very pedestrian. I think these dishes cater to the older crowd that doesn't like bold flavors but enjoys shuffle board. It reminded me of something I might get at a buffet.   Overall, I wouldn't recommend TR to anyone that wants good Italian food or knows how to cook. But if you want ambiance and don't mind making a meal out of the Garlic knots, then this is your place!

fOyEC0K0rGRx4Aja8toUHA.text: Turned away when more than half the restaurant was empty for "reservations" when I counted at least 10 empty tables. Was told the wait would be approx 2 hours! Went to CPK & walked by again about 45 minutes later, all tables still empty.... I understand how reservations take precedence as a former host, but a lot of people no show. I've never been turned away from a restaurant with this many empty tables before. Management seriously needs to reevaluate how you do business with walk ins.

soMSOkLjSTZvQ2tFrI9E0w.text: My girlfriends and I came here for ladies night on Wednesday and it was one of the best happy hours I've ever been to! So many drinks to choose from and the bar staff was very fast and attentive! We also had the eggplant app and it was very good

jk0HmX7UiJo3xH3Wmk9fvA.text: I cannot begin to tell you how disappointed I am with the food at this restaurant. Our waiter was excellent! He always kept our drinks full and our table attended to. The pasta, I kid you not, tasted EXACTLY like Chef Boyardee ravioli. We will not be going back. Macaroni Grill beats this place by miles.

5QCrGNPsIe8Iu21E2fHaYw.text: They are open late on a weekday, which is how we ended up here. There was good live music outside and, oh my goodness, the garlic knots!!! We will definitely be back.

DxzRIusZTGRLr2N2fhvUtA.text: Came here for some drinks and a appetizer before a movie.  Really enjoyed it here and we will be back.

v62zG6auuTwp8RTMMgah5Q.text: I simply love this place. I do not live in Las Vegas but have been here a few times. The food is great, the service wonderful and the environment is just fun. I truly wish I lived near this restaurant. Not fancy just real good.

RfXbnhC_aUkxgL88HV0kMA.text: Food is a 10!! Our server, Domenico, was okay, but a little strange. Again, our pizza, arugula salad, and eggplant rollatinis were AMAZING, but watching Domenico touch our leftovers with his fingers while putting them into a to-go box was tough. Two stars off for that grossness. We intended to leave a $15 tip on a $53 bill, but took back $5 once we saw our food get manhandled.  I think we will be ordering from Uber Eats from now on instead of dining in.

o8fa8zzVLZ-LOLWpRBr-hg.text: Our service was great and the food was good but I feel like it was a little over priced.  Maybe it is because Trattoria is in downtown summerlin but $18 for a salad seems excessive to me. We ordered the Kale salad, a margherita pizza and a cannoli. The garlic knots served before hand were amazing! I could have eaten a whole basket of those and left content. They were warm, fresh and smeared with butter and garlic. Carb heaven.   Our server was great and split the salad for us so we each had a good portioned amount and the pizza came out perfectly with a chewy crust and a little char on it from the brick oven. They use authentic Italian tomato sauce here and the flavors and unmatched. The cannoli was authentic and perfectly sweet and a nice finish to the meal.    I forsee enjoying the patio here when it isn't oven temperatures outside and I would like to come back to try a happy hour here as well. I appreciated how well our server took care of us.

JLceGcwhcyUuzmvms3o6lg.text: I stumbled across this restaurant from being tagged on Facebook since I work just down the street in the Downtown shopping center. The flyer said "Ladies Night" and attached to it was quite a number of cocktails, wine and beer. The selection was amazing so I figured why not check it out from 6:00-8:00pm. There was a live singer and another guy on keys. The vibe was very jazzy and the food smelled incredible when you walk in the door. I was there early enough to grab a high top round table  and hold a few spaces for friends that were joining me. The waitress comes to your table to bring you any of the selected items on the open bar list and we did t have to go to the bar and lose our place. The music did not drown out your conversation either as I had close to 20 ladies that ended up joining me that evening. I will be back for sure and I had an amazing time! The small bites during Happy Hour are calling my name the next time around.

hxzg825taDJiLHRjqSYH_Q.text: Pretty satisfied with this restaurant. I normally don't venture out to Summerlin, but a group of my friends wanted to meet up since it had been a while since we all saw each other. Although it was warm outside, we sat in the outer dinning area and felt fine. The fans kept us really cool and we were shielded from the sun. Every table gets free bread and a plate of olives, cheese and other little vegetables. I ordered the pesto gnocchi which was just okay. I'm allergic to dairy so it is often hard to find a good meal without cheese in it at Italian restaurants. I think next time I will try the spaghetti and meatballs.   The prices are definitely high, so it's more of a place to celebrate a special occasion. Our waitress was super nice and patient with us. I would definitely go back for a date night

RJceElK6KsY3fDDWUZHFLQ.text: Took my daughter to the movies, she is 10. We decided to eat at this place before as we were early. Service was okay in the beginning, after we ordered a pizza and my daughter ordered a salad as well. We had no plates... for those, we had a few pieces of pizzas she was full, I was fairly full still had pizza on the table, my cell phone and had not seen the waiter in a bit. She had to go to the bathroom. The bathrooms are multi gender so at 10 I stand outside, don't care where  we are. Go back to the table, food gone,phone gone, all is gone. I look at whomever I can  catch eye contact with...the server and manager at the same time.  Manager says we thought you left... really? Phone on table, etc. Okay fine, how am I gone if I don't have a check and leave my phone?  She said we thought you left sir, I ask...how? Offers to remake the pizza as we were taking it home with us but why? For me it's about getting it together. Like hire another waiter. The excuse was you should have told your waiter, if I would have seen him I would have. Either do away with dual gender bathrooms or hire more staff. Like there are no single dads out there. #payattention

2zOZCptzJn8xtOK37uhZDA.text: The garlic knots are so delicious!! Clams with linguine lacked luster, but the pizzas were pretty good. I like the atmosphere and the convenient location. There is a cute outdoor patio and paper table covers so you could color/draw during your meal; I thought that was a nice touch. Seriously though, I must repeat myself, the garlic knots are pretty insane.

T3fdqoUs9n_cYZ25rTrXSw.text: Great place to stop for a drink while shopping. Food was great. Ricki was AWESOME!!! Best service I've had in Vegas so far. I would definitely recommend this place. Ask for Ricki

w9fng-DVJEUaxfBVzb_lGg.text: We went to this joint recently and I'm on the fence. I've heard nothing but great things from the one on the strip. This one is much closer to home.   Service: Our waiter was Jason. The poor guy seemed so stressed and the entire restaurant seemed understaffed. First downside. Jason was great though. Even though he seemed rushed, he was very attentive and quick to make sure our drinks were filled and our food came out in a very timely manner.  His manager or whomever the older gentleman was at the window for food was not. He kept yelling out at the waiters. Which I felt was insanely unprofessional because that window is right next to tables. This is a very open restaurant and you can see all of the cooking staff.  There was a time that Jason was taking our order and the manager yelled out "Jason! Order up!" And Jason kind of glanced over at him to show him that he was in the middle of taking our order.  Who does this? I don't know. But I hope he sees this and realizes that it makes him look horrible and the restaurant in general.  Also, hire more people or staff appropriately. We went during prime time, 7:30ish. You should be fully staffed. Otherwise, you have a bunch of waiters running around trying to serve a ridiculous amount of tables and people are going to start to get frustrated.   Food: I wasn't really that impressed. The calamari was good, but a bit too peppery. The marinara was very good and very flavorful. We also had the lobster ravioli and the lasagna.  Ravioli...it was good. It was probably my favorite dish. But the lasagna kind of lacked in flavor. It was very mediocre and pretty plain. Which in my experiences in Las Vegas, it's all roughly the same for lasagna for some odd reason.   The restaurant itself isn't very large. They have a nice sized patio if you want to dine outside and they do have a nice selection of wines. The best was they have a nice description of what the wine is, so that is very helpful. We had the Barbera D'Asti. I highly recommend if you like red full bodied wines.  The prices we reasonable as well.   Overall, I'm sure I'll go back to try other dishes. It's a nice location and another good addition to the Summerlin Downton Mall.

LWsKKHleCCH3N8fi2mp50A.text: Wow. First time and last time. Reservations for 6:45. Seated at 7:30. Service was terrible. I ordered primavera pizza. Soggy and tasteless. Sent it back and ordered Bolognese. Husband ordered Scampi. Pasta undercooked and tasteless. Shrimp were ok. Terrible experience. A lady came in with a dog that sat in a chair and we overheard this was a lady with the owner. Wow.

oLQvVVSbV-P8vsv7vTcI4Q.text: I went here with my co worker before we went to a concert on New Year's day.  The hostess was a little rude when I said I had no RSVP and seated us in the patio in the freezing cold.  Luckily they had heaters.  The food was good.  I had the Scampi and my co worker had the Frutta de mare.  I'll be back to try the desserts with my husband.  It was pricey but I think it was good overall.

EEVbleS1ntLTF-c2FpREHw.text: Trattoria Reggiano is a wonderful restaurant. The food is great the service is top notch. The atmosphere is the best in downtown Summerlin. I highly recommend this spot for lunch, dinner or drinks. Best pizza in Vegas!

pGTEEjdTYk0wibHIv1HtuQ.text: We had an amazing dinner here. Bethany was attentive and friendly! I had the bake ziti with meatballs (took half home just as amazing heated up the next day.) great atmosphere we will definitely be back! Thank you!

DDwrYZT_1AH1atBQwmpGJw.text: My wife, daughter and I came to Trattoria Reggiano to give it a try after some friends recommended it to us. I would have to say that this place is great. You can tell they are still getting come grand opening details figured out but the food and service were excellent! I have to make sure to mention that Vito the manager went above and beyond to make sure our experience was pleasant. It's not easy going out with a 15 month old and I felt welcome here. I hope they keep it because I plan on returning. Oh and before I forget the meatballs were unreal!

WwIVRZU7csZ1VgHwvvmZoQ.text: A friend of mine recommended this place to me. I was hesitant at first, but then just decided to try it out. I was very pleased. I went with my husband and our 9 yr old son. I had the Gnocci al Pesto and...OH. MY. GOD. It was so delicious. My husband had the Baked Ziti with Meatballs - it looked do good, I had to taste it. Oh the cheesy goodness! And my son had the pepperoni pizza - normal 9 yr old boy food. He loved it too! He ate more than half of it which is a miracle in itself, because he's not a big eater. Our server, Theresa was very nice and very pleasant. The restaurant is small and quaint but felt authentic and welcoming. We couldn't have been happier with our experience, and will definitely be returning soon...especially since it is our new favorite Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I even like it more than Maggiano's.

2bX3zeZpd1zRsKZXCbxX9A.text: This is our favorite local italian restaurant! The food is always consistently delicious and the complimentary garlic knots are to die for! Ricki, our regular server is the bestest. She always makes us feel welcome with her great big smile when she sees us. I just love her! She remembers all our favs and never messes up our order.  You cannot go wrong with any of their pasta dishes. Always comes perfecty al dente and they do not skimp of the sauces. The clams and shrimp are always fresh and cooked perfectly.  Love, love this place!

NEFSw_UO6_uTSqFv3VmLOQ.text: After a reply from restaurant, I decided to give them another try.  Last night had a very enjoyable dinner.  The food was very good and they have a great kids menu. I will definitely eat here again

g-y_hl4wOnJq13chuTwcLg.text: I have found heaven on earth.  There are not enough adjectives to describe the amazing meal my friend and I had last night.  If you are looking for a TASTY gluten free pizza look no further. I have tried endless gluten free choices for pizza and this was by far the BEST I've ever had!   We also had the filet mignon meatballs which were RIDICULOUS and the eggplant rollatini melted in your mouth.  Finally an Italian place in Summerlin that brings you back to New York Italian.  Yummmm!  Can't wait to go back and try more.  My neighbor was eating penne Alla vodka and RAVED about it so that is next!   Oh and did I mention the staff was friendly and service was thumbs up!   Located right next to movie theatre in downtown Summerlin! Thank you Trattoria!!

yST00ntsXluXP7nyVk_Nbw.text: The over all taste of the food was very good.  Lobster Ravioli and Bucatini with garlic knots. Our order was a to go order.  First call had to hang up and call back into place my order because the guy didn't know the menu.  Second call the young lady was on point.  We will be going back to try more items on the menu. I approve this message J K KUHL..

csDFLODl_ziQCMy-UFTimA.text: I decided to try this place out for a late Sunday dinner. The outside seating was cozy and the weather was perfect. The bread served before dinner was amazing! The server called it bread but it was delicious garlic knots. Calamari also amazing as an appetizer and finished up with a bruschetta pizza.  It was all plenty of food to share for 2.

LmysZFhEY4FkDZfqwUzGxg.text: I was unimpressed. The service was disinterested. The food was average. My husband ordered gluten free pasta, but we're fairly sure he was not given gluten free pasta because he was ill afterwards and we were not charged the additional *$5.00* when the bill arrived. If you are gluten free whether by choice or by necessity, be sure to check.

PcZgBQGj50lQZjdMkM991Q.text: The reason we went it was because the waiter was friendly and allowing my dog to sit with us outside.  We ordered pizza, it came out buried,  the garlic knots  were  too greasy for us..  The coffee were like hot water, no coffee taste at all. The spaghetti with meatball is nothing to get excited.  The only thing good about this is allowing my dog to sat with us.

L9MVQ8JCC_P11TcjYmwXng.text: Pleasantly surprised, excellent service. I had made a reservation and we were seated exactly upon arrival on a Friday night. Food was large portions, well prepared but I was most surprised by the attentive service. I've eaten at every restaurant in downtown Summerlin and this one just jumped to one of our favorites. Much better than Grape Street both in terms of food quality and definitely in terms of service. Keep it up!

p0GR4DcngaDckhcLR17prw.text: Wow! From the moment you walk in to this place you know you are going to eat real Italian food! The smells in here are stunning! The kitchen overlooks the dinning area so you can see your food being cooked right in front of you! Very cozy intimate spot, great for a date night and great food! Staff was excellent and took care of all our needs. I had the chicken parm, it was very tasty, chicken was juicy and not fried tasting. Red sauce is very Southern Italian, pizzas are big and flavorful. This will be a weekly spot to eat at! Finally real Italian food in Summerlin! Looking forward to trying other dishes!!! Yum!

GzvysA0i_CIZDV9-jlWXOA.text: Trattoria Reggiano must have taken note of my critical review. In my three times being back at this establishment since my less than exceptional first experience, I have found that the service, food, and ambiance has improved tremendously. This location has gone from one that I nearly disdained, to one that I recommend to colleagues without hesitation. The unprecedented turnaround that this fantastic restaurant underwent is nothing short of astounding, and I look forward to enjoying the impressive Trattoria Reggiano for a long time.   (P.S.) My Reccomendations:  1st Course: Calamari 2nd Course: Chicken Francese or Veal Milanese  3rd Course: Tiramasu

vb1Eefe7qjS-msPcD_u4Tg.text: My boyfriend and I decided to try this place last night,July 26 for our anniversary since we live close by and both love Italian food. We went in at around 8:45 and were seated immediately and were told that they close at 10- which is fine.   Our night quickly turned when we met our waitress. She was extremely rude and was reluctant to answer any of our questions. When I asked "what is the difference between a small Caesar salad and a large?" She rolled her eyes and said a small is a small and a large is a large."As if we didn't already know that. So then I asked another question, "is a small salad enough for two people to share?" To which she replied, "it depends on your appetite." ABSOLUTELY NO HELP AT ALL. So we ordered the small Caesar to share and the portion was so small my boyfriend just told me to have it. After this our waitress didn't check in at our table one time. She walked past and would say "is everything ok?" But wouldn't even stop walking to hear our answers.  This type of behavior would be somewhat understandable if they were busy but we were one of only three tables in the restaurant!   I could go on and on about how rude our waitress was but I think that about sums it up. I will say this however, at the end of our meal when we asked for boxes, she boxed up my boyfriends food and I boxed up my own, which I didn't mind. My boyfriend took his left over baked ziti with meatballs to work with him today and guess what? The waitress didn't put the meatballs in the to go container.  After paying the high prices of the entrees and wanting to take some home one would assume you would get everything you paid for in the to go container but apparently not.    We went here to celebrate what should have been a great night, but our service was so poor, half way through the meal both of us were upset.   I am in the food industry as a waitress and I usually don't write yelp reviews like this but this was the WORST dining experience I have ever had in my life.   I did give two stars however because the food was good, and the hostess and busser staff were very friendly. But our experience was so sour we will never be back.

jr7mAnWhlpifmiFyvZazMQ.text: The second star is for the garlic knots. We ordered a pizza. I've lived in NYC, I've had great pizza. Been wanting to try this place for a while. I'm not exaggerating: the pizza came to the table cold and soaking and flimsy as a wet noodle. Literally like a cold, wet noodle. The "crust" was so incredibly thin and floppy and wet and cold that I started to take a photo for this review BUT before I could do that, a woman collapsed in the restaurant and hit her head and wasn't getting up. Please understand this next part and read carefully: I was sitting at the far end of the restaurant and there was a ridiculous amount of servers working in this place. Like two servers to a customer. At least 15. The bartender, servers, hostess, and manager just stood there like stunned sheep, so I was the first person to call 911. After running across the restaurant by myself, they obviously had no kind of training in place for an emergency situation. People acted like I was a hero for merely possessing common sense. After the ambulance showed up and took the woman away, the general manager commended me and comped our entire bill. I explained the pizza issue to him and he acted like he knew about it and was embarrassed, but here's the kicker: the guy was from New York....and he allows his kitchen to serve sloppy cold pizza!? But hey, the free garlic knots were incredible!

IzyUkBVX4U6pi63UOj3nGA.text: Outstanding! Must see Eli at the bar. Amazing appetizers, salad, main course!!! Eli's wine selection was superb!! Bringing friends back here soon...

dcgyvkMm_aOoeG5VZec0dg.text: To start let me say we found our new local favorite!  We recently found this little gem after seeing a movie at Downtown Summerlin.  We plan on visiting for dinner prior to our future date night at the movies.  The restaurant is literally right next door to the theater.  Service is top notch!  We started with a drink at the bar so we would have a chance to look at the menu.  The bartender was very gracious and answered our questions about their specialty drinks and wines.  After looking at the menu we decided to have dinner and were promptly seated.  Our waiter was right there to greet us and answered our menu questions.  He also asked if we were seeing a movie so he could time our dinner if necessary.  I ordered my fave, eggplant parm which was awesome.  Perfectly cooked and not loaded with cheese.  My better half had a kale salad which was actually very good.  I rarely order healthy dishes but may rethink this as the salad had a great dressing and was a nice change from the standard caesar.  The manager Vito stopped by twice to check in on us and offered us a complimentary plate of olives and cheese which was a nice touch which you rarely see these days.  My only complaint is the lack of restrooms.  They only have one unisex restroom which is located in a busy hallway so it was bit awkward with a couple of us waiting in line.  I have already recommended it to friends so I would give it try.  You will not be disappointed.

1J9OED-cki9NMJMvWvd_lg.text: Delicious! I really enjoyed this place and the service! The manager came over to our table during one visit to check in with us and was extremely attentive and friendly. I could go back every night just for the garlic knots. I've never had the pizza here but can tell you the pasta meals and appetizers (chicken parm and marsala and the fried calamari) are amazing! Not a large wine selection unless you buy by the bottle which is a bummer for me, but still worth the trip! WOULD LOVEEEE gift cards available for here... especially with the holidays coming up. Also would LOVE a to go menu. With gift cards and to go menus, this place would be that much more amazing. Gift cards please!! :)

K9JUrB-y6YwpD4j2vra8-w.text: I really wish they would get some servers who had a sense of urgency. The last time we went i swore it off, but its right next to the movies. The food is really good. Ill either get a pizza or the veal chop parm on the bone. All the food is good but they have zero attention to detail and they are so slooooooooooooow. Last time was the worst. This time things started off well, appetizer came out quickly, food came fast too. Then it's just crickets. Sit sit sit sit.. I decided to walk around to find our waiter. No where to be found. I ask the hostess if she can locate him. She came back and said the guy is in the bathroom. I get it, guy has to go, but use ur head and ask someone to look after your tables if u r gonna be 20 mins. Finally, we got the check, i left 10 bux on 70 and a note telling them how slow they are. Im not going back anymore. It good food but not worth guarantees awful service.

pQJosrgfWtEHrsHVln6HYg.text: I'd give 3.5 if available, but I'm feeling generous so I'll round up.    4 of us went for a Saturday night dinner.  We had reservations for 7:30 and they seated us immediately.  Restaurant was clean, staff was about as friendly as you could reasonably expect with a packed house on a hot Vegas night.   Here are a few, admittedly minor, critiques. - our waiter was an older gentleman, with a thick, we thought possibly added on and emphasized for 'authenticity' accent.  He clearly struggled with the whole placing the order via iPad thing, especially when one in the party ordered something he wasn't familiar with (but was on the menu and no changes were requested).  - The pasta e fagioli was certainly nothing to remember, which is disappointing with the 'we're in DTS so we can overcharge' pricepoint on all the dishes. - and one of my pet peeves, they didn't bring all the entrees out at the same time.  They brought three and one in the party had to wait for a while until theirs arrived.    Not sure if I'll go back.  Food was solid (save the soup), but the price was rather high for what you get and there are better Italian options in town.

wGYAVOCJ98jYaI1jKWntug.text: After an hot Vegas afternoon of shopping my friend and I decided to stop for a salad and glass of wine.....so glad we passed on our original stop and tried something new.  We were promptly seated and waited on.  We ordered the peanut kale and caesar salad (added shrimp) and split a carafe of red sangria.  Everything was very fresh and well presented.  We really enjoyed the complimentary garlic knots.  Will be bringing more guests more often.

Vch9ywWTWQ89lyb2LInQOQ.text: The food was good,however the place was understaffed.The server really didnt know italian food or wine.We asked several questions about the wine list and nobody could properly answer them.If you work in an Italian restraunt you really should know the difference between chianti and barolo.Surprised they dont hire more experienced serversll

m9Qy2pkNfldpNo80c-TiMg.text: Had lunch there in April after having gone to the restaurant in the Venetian previously and enjoyed it very much. This location is a little off the strip in an open air complex, which was nice change. The aesthetics of the restaurant was very nice, the service personable and the food excellent! We came a little after the lunch rush and were seated immediately inside (although the open air seating would have suited us fine as well). The Garlic bread served with oil was very good. My meal consisted of the ravioli and my dining partner had a salad. Both were excellent. Well prepared and filling. Even after being stuffed from the bread and entree's, we split a canoli...which was amazing! We will definitely be stopping by the next time we are in Las Vegas.

ZnOEgsJ9ljywNkW50O2kcA.text: My family decided to eat out this Sunday. We yelped Italian restaurants and saw the four stars so decided to give it a try. The restaurant was clean and the staff were attentive.  The restaurant was not busy(maybe a third full). The food had little to be desired.  The food was no better than the popular Italian chain--they even use the same boxed pasta! We started with calamari which were rubbery and greasy and served with an odd colored "red" sauce that was actually orange. I had tortellini with Alfredo sauce which was melted butter mixed with cream and very watery. No herbs or flavor whatsoever.  The tortellini was not house made and over cooked to boot! They were happy to take my tortellini and remake something else but after eating a stick of watery butter from my first bite, I lost my appetite.  My husband ordered veal parmigiana but the waiter brought some odd fried meat with a salad on the top!  Oops. My son ordered chicken parmigiana.  He said it was ok. We were out for a family meal and my son ended up eating alone while my husband and I watched.  Right about the time my son finished eating his meal my husbands actual order came so we got to watch him eat.  Not exactly the family dinner we had in mind.  Very pricey for "chain" quality food.  I would not recommend this restaurant.

vV8cLvnedzsoB5lKtR5NRA.text: The concept seemed lovely with an indoor/outdoor feel, but the food will not make a repeat visitor out of me. The garlic knots and an antipasto plate were very nice, however the salads we ordered were entree sized rather than starters-would have preferred half the size at half the price. The Kale salad with peanut dressing was difficult to eat as it was very spicy and very heavily dressed. The Margareta pizza my husband ordered which comes with no cheese (lactose intolerant) was COVERED in capers which were not mentioned anywhere. That is a very specific ingredient that serves mention on the menu. He is not a fan so rolled most off and ate half. I ordered salmon and vegetables-the preparation was fine although a lot of oil appeared on the plate mixed with the lemon sauce-not a fan of that much oil. The vegetables were heirloom squash and zucchini-really cute vegetables! Overall just very hefty priced and neither of us was impressed with our items. Perhaps the pasta is the way to go as there is a very authentic vibe-but we'll pass on by next time in Downtown Summerlin.

cKMTIBQRy9oJNIYwOZnKhQ.text: overprice and mediocre.Servers were pleasant but not very knowledgeable about Italinan food or wine.We asked several about Italian wines and no one knew what we were talking about .Very surprised they dont hire more experienced  service personal..some Italians!
